text:
How blessed is the man who does not walk in the counsel of the wicked,
Nor stand in the path of sinners,
Nor sit in the seat of scoffers!
speaker: Narrator

text:
But his delight is in the law of the Lord,
And in His law he meditates day and night.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will be like a tree firmly planted by streams of water,
Which yields its fruit in its season
And its leaf does not wither;
And in whatever he does, he prospers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked are not so,
But they are like chaff which the wind drives away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore the wicked will not stand in the judgment,
Nor sinners in the assembly of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord knows the way of the righteous,
But the way of the wicked will perish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why are the nations in an uproar
And the peoples devising a vain thing?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The kings of the earth take their stand
And the rulers take counsel together
Against the Lord and against His Anointed, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Let us tear their fetters apart
And cast away their cords from us!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who sits in the heavens laughs,
The Lord scoffs at them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then He will speak to them in His anger
And terrify them in His fury, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“But as for Me, I have installed My King
Upon Zion, My holy mountain.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I will surely tell of the decree of the Lord:
He said to Me, ‘You are My Son,
Today I have begotten You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘Ask of Me, and I will surely give the nations as Your inheritance,
And the very ends of the earth as Your possession.
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘You shall break them with a rod of iron,
You shall shatter them like earthenware.’”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now therefore, O kings, show discernment;
Take warning, O judges of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Worship the Lord with reverence
And rejoice with trembling.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do homage to the Son, that He not become angry, and you perish in the way,
For His wrath may soon be kindled.
How blessed are all who take refuge in Him!
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, how my adversaries have increased!
Many are rising up against me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many are saying of my soul,
“There is no deliverance for him in God.” Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But You, O Lord, are a shield about me,
My glory, and the One who lifts my head.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was crying to the Lord with my voice,
And He answered me from His holy mountain. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I lay down and slept;
I awoke, for the Lord sustains me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will not be afraid of ten thousands of people
Who have set themselves against me round about.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Salvation belongs to the Lord;
Your blessing be upon Your people! Selah.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
O sons of men, how long will my honor become a reproach?
How long will you love what is worthless and aim at deception? Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But know that the Lord has set apart the godly man for Himself;
The Lord hears when I call to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tremble, and do not sin;
Meditate in your heart upon your bed, and be still. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Offer the sacrifices of righteousness,
And trust in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many are saying, “Who will show us any good?”
Lift up the light of Your countenance upon us, O Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have put gladness in my heart,
More than when their grain and new wine abound.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In peace I will both lie down and sleep,
For You alone, O Lord, make me to dwell in safety.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give ear to my words, O Lord,
Consider my groaning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Heed the sound of my cry for help, my King and my God,
For to You I pray.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the morning, O Lord, You will hear my voice;
In the morning I will order my prayer to You and eagerly watch.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For You are not a God who takes pleasure in wickedness;
No evil dwells with You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The boastful shall not stand before Your eyes;
You hate all who do iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You destroy those who speak falsehood;
The Lord abhors the man of bloodshed and deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But as for me, by Your abundant lovingkindness I will enter Your house,
At Your holy temple I will bow in reverence for You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, lead me in Your righteousness because of my foes;
Make Your way straight before me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Hold them guilty, O God;
By their own devices let them fall!
In the multitude of their transgressions thrust them out,
For they are rebellious against You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But let all who take refuge in You be glad,
Let them ever sing for joy;
And may You shelter them,
That those who love Your name may exult in You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For it is You who blesses the righteous man, O Lord,
You surround him with favor as with a shield.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, do not rebuke me in Your anger,
Nor chasten me in Your wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be gracious to me, O Lord, for I am pining away;
Heal me, O Lord, for my bones are dismayed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And my soul is greatly dismayed;
But You, O Lord—how long?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Return, O Lord, rescue my soul;
Save me because of Your lovingkindness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For there is no mention of You in death;
In Sheol who will give You thanks?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
My eye has wasted away with grief;
It has become old because of all my adversaries.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Depart from me, all you who do iniquity,
For the Lord has heard the voice of my weeping.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has heard my supplication,
The Lord receives my prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All my enemies will be ashamed and greatly dismayed;
They shall turn back, they will suddenly be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord my God, in You I have taken refuge;
Save me from all those who pursue me, and deliver me,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Or he will tear my soul like a lion,
Dragging me away, while there is none to deliver.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord my God, if I have done this,
If there is injustice in my hands,
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I have rewarded evil to my friend,
Or have plundered him who without cause was my adversary,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Let the assembly of the peoples encompass You,
And over them return on high.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord judges the peoples;
Vindicate me, O Lord, according to my righteousness and my integrity that is in me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O let the evil of the wicked come to an end, but establish the righteous;
For the righteous God tries the hearts and minds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My shield is with God,
Who saves the upright in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God is a righteous judge,
And a God who has indignation every day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If a man does not repent, He will sharpen His sword;
He has bent His bow and made it ready.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has also prepared for Himself deadly weapons;
He makes His arrows fiery shafts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, he travails with wickedness,
And he conceives mischief and brings forth falsehood.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has dug a pit and hollowed it out,
And has fallen into the hole which he made.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His mischief will return upon his own head,
And his violence will descend upon his own pate.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give thanks to the Lord according to His righteousness
And will sing praise to the name of the Lord Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, our Lord,
How majestic is Your name in all the earth,
Who have displayed Your splendor above the heavens!
speaker: Narrator

text:
From the mouth of infants and nursing babes You have established strength
Because of Your adversaries,
To make the enemy and the revengeful cease.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I consider Your heavens, the work of Your fingers,
The moon and the stars, which You have ordained;
speaker: Narrator

text:
What is man that You take thought of him,
And the son of man that You care for him?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet You have made him a little lower than God,
And You crown him with glory and majesty!
speaker: Narrator

text:
You make him to rule over the works of Your hands;
You have put all things under his feet,
speaker: Narrator

text:
All sheep and oxen,
And also the beasts of the field,
speaker: Narrator

text:
The birds of the heavens and the fish of the sea,
Whatever passes through the paths of the seas.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, our Lord,
How majestic is Your name in all the earth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give thanks to the Lord with all my heart;
I will tell of all Your wonders.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will be glad and exult in You;
I will sing praise to Your name, O Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When my enemies turn back,
They stumble and perish before You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For You have maintained my just cause;
You have sat on the throne judging righteously.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have rebuked the nations, You have destroyed the wicked;
You have blotted out their name forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
But the Lord abides forever;
He has established His throne for judgment,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And He will judge the world in righteousness;
He will execute judgment for the peoples with equity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord also will be a stronghold for the oppressed,
A stronghold in times of trouble;
speaker: Narrator

text:
And those who know Your name will put their trust in You,
For You, O Lord, have not forsaken those who seek You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing praises to the Lord, who dwells in Zion;
Declare among the peoples His deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For He who requires blood remembers them;
He does not forget the cry of the afflicted.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
That I may tell of all Your praises,
That in the gates of the daughter of Zion
I may rejoice in Your salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The nations have sunk down in the pit which they have made;
In the net which they hid, their own foot has been caught.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The wicked will return to Sheol,
Even all the nations who forget God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the needy will not always be forgotten,
Nor the hope of the afflicted perish forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, O Lord, do not let man prevail;
Let the nations be judged before You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Put them in fear, O Lord;
Let the nations know that they are but men. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why do You stand afar off, O Lord?
Why do You hide Yourself in times of trouble?
speaker: Narrator

text:
In pride the wicked hotly pursue the afflicted;
Let them be caught in the plots which they have devised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the wicked boasts of his heart’s desire,
And the greedy man curses and spurns the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked, in the haughtiness of his countenance, does not seek Him.
All his thoughts are, “There is no God.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
He says to himself, “I will not be moved;
Throughout all generations I will not be in adversity.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
His mouth is full of curses and deceit and oppression;
Under his tongue is mischief and wickedness.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
He crouches, he bows down,
And the unfortunate fall by his mighty ones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He says to himself, “God has forgotten;
He has hidden His face; He will never see it.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, O Lord; O God, lift up Your hand.
Do not forget the afflicted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why has the wicked spurned God?
He has said to himself, “You will not require it.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Break the arm of the wicked and the evildoer,
Seek out his wickedness until You find none.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is King forever and ever;
Nations have perished from His land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, You have heard the desire of the humble;
You will strengthen their heart, You will incline Your ear
speaker: Narrator

text:
To vindicate the orphan and the oppressed,
So that man who is of the earth will no longer cause terror.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the Lord I take refuge;
How can you say to my soul, “Flee as a bird to your mountain;
speaker: Narrator

text:
For, behold, the wicked bend the bow,
They make ready their arrow upon the string
To shoot in darkness at the upright in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If the foundations are destroyed,
What can the righteous do?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is in His holy temple; the Lord’s throne is in heaven;
His eyes behold, His eyelids test the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord tests the righteous and the wicked,
And the one who loves violence His soul hates.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Upon the wicked He will rain snares;
Fire and brimstone and burning wind will be the portion of their cup.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord is righteous, He loves righteousness;
The upright will behold His face.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Help, Lord, for the godly man ceases to be,
For the faithful disappear from among the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They speak falsehood to one another;
With flattering lips and with a double heart they speak.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the Lord cut off all flattering lips,
The tongue that speaks great things;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who have said, “With our tongue we will prevail;
Our lips are our own; who is lord over us?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Because of the devastation of the afflicted, because of the groaning of the needy,
Now I will arise,” says the Lord; “I will set him in the safety for which he longs.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The words of the Lord are pure words;
As silver tried in a furnace on the earth, refined seven times.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You, O Lord, will keep them;
You will preserve him from this generation forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked strut about on every side
When vileness is exalted among the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long, O Lord? Will You forget me forever?
How long will You hide Your face from me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
How long shall I take counsel in my soul,
Having sorrow in my heart all the day?
How long will my enemy be exalted over me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Consider and answer me, O Lord my God;
Enlighten my eyes, or I will sleep the sleep of death,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And my enemy will say, “I have overcome him,”
And my adversaries will rejoice when I am shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I have trusted in Your lovingkindness;
My heart shall rejoice in Your salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will sing to the Lord,
Because He has dealt bountifully with me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The Lord has looked down from heaven upon the sons of men
To see if there are any who understand,
Who seek after God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have all turned aside, together they have become corrupt;
There is no one who does good, not even one.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do all the workers of wickedness not know,
Who eat up my people as they eat bread,
And do not call upon the Lord?
speaker: Narrator

text:
There they are in great dread,
For God is with the righteous generation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You would put to shame the counsel of the afflicted,
But the Lord is his refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh, that the salvation of Israel would come out of Zion!
When the Lord restores His captive people,
Jacob will rejoice, Israel will be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, who may abide in Your tent?
Who may dwell on Your holy hill?
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who walks with integrity, and works righteousness,
And speaks truth in his heart.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
He does not put out his money at interest,
Nor does he take a bribe against the innocent.
He who does these things will never be shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Preserve me, O God, for I take refuge in You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said to the Lord, “You are my Lord;
I have no good besides You.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for the saints who are in the earth,
They are the majestic ones in whom is all my delight.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The Lord is the portion of my inheritance and my cup;
You support my lot.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The lines have fallen to me in pleasant places;
Indeed, my heritage is beautiful to me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will bless the Lord who has counseled me;
Indeed, my mind instructs me in the night.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have set the Lord continually before me;
Because He is at my right hand, I will not be shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore my heart is glad and my glory rejoices;
My flesh also will dwell securely.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For You will not abandon my soul to Sheol;
Nor will You allow Your Holy One to undergo decay.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Hear a just cause, O Lord, give heed to my cry;
Give ear to my prayer, which is not from deceitful lips.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my judgment come forth from Your presence;
Let Your eyes look with equity.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
As for the deeds of men, by the word of Your lips
I have kept from the paths of the violent.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My steps have held fast to Your paths.
My feet have not slipped.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have called upon You, for You will answer me, O God;
Incline Your ear to me, hear my speech.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wondrously show Your lovingkindness,
O Savior of those who take refuge at Your right hand
From those who rise up against them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep me as the apple of the eye;
Hide me in the shadow of Your wings
speaker: Narrator

text:
From the wicked who despoil me,
My deadly enemies who surround me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have closed their unfeeling heart,
With their mouth they speak proudly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have now surrounded us in our steps;
They set their eyes to cast us down to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is like a lion that is eager to tear,
And as a young lion lurking in hiding places.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, O Lord, confront him, bring him low;
Deliver my soul from the wicked with Your sword,
speaker: Narrator

text:
From men with Your hand, O Lord,
From men of the world, whose portion is in this life,
And whose belly You fill with Your treasure;
They are satisfied with children,
And leave their abundance to their babes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for me, I shall behold Your face in righteousness;
I will be satisfied with Your likeness when I awake.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I love You, O Lord, my strength.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I call upon the Lord, who is worthy to be praised,
And I am saved from my enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The cords of death encompassed me,
And the torrents of ungodliness terrified me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The cords of Sheol surrounded me;
The snares of death confronted me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In my distress I called upon the Lord,
And cried to my God for help;
He heard my voice out of His temple,
And my cry for help before Him came into His ears.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
He bowed the heavens also, and came down
With thick darkness under His feet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He rode upon a cherub and flew;
And He sped upon the wings of the wind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He made darkness His hiding place, His canopy around Him,
Darkness of waters, thick clouds of the skies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
From the brightness before Him passed His thick clouds,
Hailstones and coals of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord also thundered in the heavens,
And the Most High uttered His voice,
Hailstones and coals of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent out His arrows, and scattered them,
And lightning flashes in abundance, and routed them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the channels of water appeared,
And the foundations of the world were laid bare
At Your rebuke, O Lord,
At the blast of the breath of Your nostrils.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent from on high, He took me;
He drew me out of many waters.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He delivered me from my strong enemy,
And from those who hated me, for they were too mighty for me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They confronted me in the day of my calamity,
But the Lord was my stay.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He brought me forth also into a broad place;
He rescued me, because He delighted in me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has rewarded me according to my righteousness;
According to the cleanness of my hands He has recompensed me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I have kept the ways of the Lord,
And have not wickedly departed from my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For all His ordinances were before me,
And I did not put away His statutes from me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was also blameless with Him,
And I kept myself from my iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore the Lord has recompensed me according to my righteousness,
According to the cleanness of my hands in His eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With the kind You show Yourself kind;
With the blameless You show Yourself blameless;
speaker: Narrator

text:
With the pure You show Yourself pure,
And with the crooked You show Yourself astute.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For You save an afflicted people,
But haughty eyes You abase.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For You light my lamp;
The Lord my God illumines my darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For by You I can run upon a troop;
And by my God I can leap over a wall.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For who is God, but the Lord?
And who is a rock, except our God,
speaker: Narrator

text:
The God who girds me with strength
And makes my way blameless?
speaker: Narrator

text:
He makes my feet like hinds’ feet,
And sets me upon my high places.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He trains my hands for battle,
So that my arms can bend a bow of bronze.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
You enlarge my steps under me,
And my feet have not slipped.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I pursued my enemies and overtook them,
And I did not turn back until they were consumed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I shattered them, so that they were not able to rise;
They fell under my feet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For You have girded me with strength for battle;
You have subdued under me those who rose up against me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have also made my enemies turn their backs to me,
And I destroyed those who hated me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They cried for help, but there was none to save,
Even to the Lord, but He did not answer them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I beat them fine as the dust before the wind;
I emptied them out as the mire of the streets.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
As soon as they hear, they obey me;
Foreigners submit to me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Foreigners fade away,
And come trembling out of their fortresses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord lives, and blessed be my rock;
And exalted be the God of my salvation,
speaker: Narrator

text:
The God who executes vengeance for me,
And subdues peoples under me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Therefore I will give thanks to You among the nations, O Lord,
And I will sing praises to Your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gives great deliverance to His king,
And shows lovingkindness to His anointed,
To David and his descendants forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heavens are telling of the glory of God;
And their expanse is declaring the work of His hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Day to day pours forth speech,
And night to night reveals knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is no speech, nor are there words;
Their voice is not heard.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their line has gone out through all the earth,
And their utterances to the end of the world.
In them He has placed a tent for the sun,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Which is as a bridegroom coming out of his chamber;
It rejoices as a strong man to run his course.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The law of the Lord is perfect, restoring the soul;
The testimony of the Lord is sure, making wise the simple.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The precepts of the Lord are right, rejoicing the heart;
The commandment of the Lord is pure, enlightening the eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The fear of the Lord is clean, enduring forever;
The judgments of the Lord are true; they are righteous altogether.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are more desirable than gold, yes, than much fine gold;
Sweeter also than honey and the drippings of the honeycomb.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Moreover, by them Your servant is warned;
In keeping them there is great reward.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who can discern his errors? Acquit me of hidden faults.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart
Be acceptable in Your sight,
O Lord, my rock and my Redeemer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the Lord answer you in the day of trouble!
May the name of the God of Jacob set you securely on high!
speaker: Narrator

text:
May He send you help from the sanctuary
And support you from Zion!
speaker: Narrator

text:
May He remember all your meal offerings
And find your burnt offering acceptable! Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May He grant you your heart’s desire
And fulfill all your counsel!
speaker: Narrator

text:
We will sing for joy over your victory,
And in the name of our God we will set up our banners.
May the Lord fulfill all your petitions.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Some boast in chariots and some in horses,
But we will boast in the name of the Lord, our God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have bowed down and fallen,
But we have risen and stood upright.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Save, O Lord;
May the King answer us in the day we call.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, in Your strength the king will be glad,
And in Your salvation how greatly he will rejoice!
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have given him his heart’s desire,
And You have not withheld the request of his lips. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For You meet him with the blessings of good things;
You set a crown of fine gold on his head.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He asked life of You,
You gave it to him,
Length of days forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His glory is great through Your salvation,
Splendor and majesty You place upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For You make him most blessed forever;
You make him joyful with gladness in Your presence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the king trusts in the Lord,
And through the lovingkindness of the Most High he will not be shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your hand will find out all your enemies;
Your right hand will find out those who hate you.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Their offspring You will destroy from the earth,
And their descendants from among the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though they intended evil against You
And devised a plot,
They will not succeed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For You will make them turn their back;
You will aim with Your bowstrings at their faces.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be exalted, O Lord, in Your strength;
We will sing and praise Your power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My God, my God, why have You forsaken me?
Far from my deliverance are the words of my groaning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O my God, I cry by day, but You do not answer;
And by night, but I have no rest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet You are holy,
O You who are enthroned upon the praises of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In You our fathers trusted;
They trusted and You delivered them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To You they cried out and were delivered;
In You they trusted and were not disappointed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I am a worm and not a man,
A reproach of men and despised by the people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All who see me sneer at me;
They separate with the lip, they wag the head, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Commit yourself to the Lord; let Him deliver him;
Let Him rescue him, because He delights in him.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet You are He who brought me forth from the womb;
You made me trust when upon my mother’s breasts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Upon You I was cast from birth;
You have been my God from my mother’s womb.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be not far from me, for trouble is near;
For there is none to help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many bulls have surrounded me;
Strong bulls of Bashan have encircled me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They open wide their mouth at me,
As a ravening and a roaring lion.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
I can count all my bones.
They look, they stare at me;
speaker: Narrator

text:
They divide my garments among them,
And for my clothing they cast lots.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But You, O Lord, be not far off;
O You my help, hasten to my assistance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deliver my soul from the sword,
My only life from the power of the dog.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Save me from the lion’s mouth;
From the horns of the wild oxen You answer me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will tell of Your name to my brethren;
In the midst of the assembly I will praise You.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
From You comes my praise in the great assembly;
I shall pay my vows before those who fear Him.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
All the ends of the earth will remember and turn to the Lord,
And all the families of the nations will worship before You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the kingdom is the Lord’s
And He rules over the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the prosperous of the earth will eat and worship,
All those who go down to the dust will bow before Him,
Even he who cannot keep his soul alive.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Posterity will serve Him;
It will be told of the Lord to the coming generation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will come and will declare His righteousness
To a people who will be born, that He has performed it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is my shepherd,
I shall not want.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He makes me lie down in green pastures;
He leads me beside quiet waters.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Surely goodness and lovingkindness will follow me all the days of my life,
And I will dwell in the house of the Lord forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The earth is the Lord’s, and all it contains,
The world, and those who dwell in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For He has founded it upon the seas
And established it upon the rivers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who may ascend into the hill of the Lord?
And who may stand in His holy place?
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who has clean hands and a pure heart,
Who has not lifted up his soul to falsehood
And has not sworn deceitfully.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He shall receive a blessing from the Lord
And righteousness from the God of his salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the generation of those who seek Him,
Who seek Your face—even Jacob. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lift up your heads, O gates,
And be lifted up, O ancient doors,
That the King of glory may come in!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who is the King of glory?
The Lord strong and mighty,
The Lord mighty in battle.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lift up your heads, O gates,
And lift them up, O ancient doors,
That the King of glory may come in!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who is this King of glory?
The Lord of hosts,
He is the King of glory. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text: To You, O Lord, I lift up my soul.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Indeed, none of those who wait for You will be ashamed;
Those who deal treacherously without cause will be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make me know Your ways, O Lord;
Teach me Your paths.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Remember, O Lord, Your compassion and Your lovingkindnesses,
For they have been from of old.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Good and upright is the Lord;
Therefore He instructs sinners in the way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He leads the humble in justice,
And He teaches the humble His way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the paths of the Lord are lovingkindness and truth
To those who keep His covenant and His testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Your name’s sake, O Lord,
Pardon my iniquity, for it is great.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who is the man who fears the Lord?
He will instruct him in the way he should choose.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His soul will abide in prosperity,
And his descendants will inherit the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The secret of the Lord is for those who fear Him,
And He will make them know His covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes are continually toward the Lord,
For He will pluck my feet out of the net.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn to me and be gracious to me,
For I am lonely and afflicted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The troubles of my heart are enlarged;
Bring me out of my distresses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look upon my affliction and my trouble,
And forgive all my sins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look upon my enemies, for they are many,
And they hate me with violent hatred.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Guard my soul and deliver me;
Do not let me be ashamed, for I take refuge in You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let integrity and uprightness preserve me,
For I wait for You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Redeem Israel, O God,
Out of all his troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Vindicate me, O Lord, for I have walked in my integrity,
And I have trusted in the Lord without wavering.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Examine me, O Lord, and try me;
Test my mind and my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Your lovingkindness is before my eyes,
And I have walked in Your truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I do not sit with deceitful men,
Nor will I go with pretenders.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hate the assembly of evildoers,
And I will not sit with the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I shall wash my hands in innocence,
And I will go about Your altar, O Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text:
That I may proclaim with the voice of thanksgiving
And declare all Your wonders.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, I love the habitation of Your house
And the place where Your glory dwells.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not take my soul away along with sinners,
Nor my life with men of bloodshed,
speaker: Narrator

text:
In whose hands is a wicked scheme,
And whose right hand is full of bribes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But as for me, I shall walk in my integrity;
Redeem me, and be gracious to me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My foot stands on a level place;
In the congregations I shall bless the Lord.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
When evildoers came upon me to devour my flesh,
My adversaries and my enemies, they stumbled and fell.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though a host encamp against me,
My heart will not fear;
Though war arise against me,
In spite of this I shall be confident.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One thing I have asked from the Lord, that I shall seek:
That I may dwell in the house of the Lord all the days of my life,
To behold the beauty of the Lord
And to meditate in His temple.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Hear, O Lord, when I cry with my voice,
And be gracious to me and answer me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When You said, “Seek My face,” my heart said to You,
“Your face, O Lord, I shall seek.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For my father and my mother have forsaken me,
But the Lord will take me up.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Teach me Your way, O Lord,
And lead me in a level path
Because of my foes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not deliver me over to the desire of my adversaries,
For false witnesses have risen against me,
And such as breathe out violence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I would have despaired unless I had believed that I would see the goodness of the Lord
In the land of the living.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
To You, O Lord, I call;
My rock, do not be deaf to me,
For if You are silent to me,
I will become like those who go down to the pit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear the voice of my supplications when I cry to You for help,
When I lift up my hands toward Your holy sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not drag me away with the wicked
And with those who work iniquity,
Who speak peace with their neighbors,
While evil is in their hearts.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Because they do not regard the works of the Lord
Nor the deeds of His hands,
He will tear them down and not build them up.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be the Lord,
Because He has heard the voice of my supplication.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The Lord is their strength,
And He is a saving defense to His anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Save Your people and bless Your inheritance;
Be their shepherd also, and carry them forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ascribe to the Lord, O sons of the mighty,
Ascribe to the Lord glory and strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ascribe to the Lord the glory due to His name;
Worship the Lord in holy array.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The voice of the Lord is powerful,
The voice of the Lord is majestic.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The voice of the Lord breaks the cedars;
Yes, the Lord breaks in pieces the cedars of Lebanon.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He makes Lebanon skip like a calf,
And Sirion like a young wild ox.
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice of the Lord hews out flames of fire.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The voice of the Lord shakes the wilderness;
The Lord shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The Lord sat as King at the flood;
Yes, the Lord sits as King forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will give strength to His people;
The Lord will bless His people with peace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will extol You, O Lord, for You have lifted me up,
And have not let my enemies rejoice over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord my God,
I cried to You for help, and You healed me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, You have brought up my soul from Sheol;
You have kept me alive, that I would not go down to the pit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing praise to the Lord, you His godly ones,
And give thanks to His holy name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For His anger is but for a moment,
His favor is for a lifetime;
Weeping may last for the night,
But a shout of joy comes in the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now as for me, I said in my prosperity,
“I will never be moved.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, by Your favor You have made my mountain to stand strong;
You hid Your face, I was dismayed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To You, O Lord, I called,
And to the Lord I made supplication:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“What profit is there in my blood, if I go down to the pit?
Will the dust praise You? Will it declare Your faithfulness?
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Hear, O Lord, and be gracious to me;
O Lord, be my helper.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have turned for me my mourning into dancing;
You have loosed my sackcloth and girded me with gladness,
speaker: Narrator

text:
That my soul may sing praise to You and not be silent.
O Lord my God, I will give thanks to You forever.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
For You are my rock and my fortress;
For Your name’s sake You will lead me and guide me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will pull me out of the net which they have secretly laid for me,
For You are my strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Into Your hand I commit my spirit;
You have ransomed me, O Lord, God of truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hate those who regard vain idols,
But I trust in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
And You have not given me over into the hand of the enemy;
You have set my feet in a large place.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be gracious to me, O Lord, for I am in distress;
My eye is wasted away from grief, my soul and my body also.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For my life is spent with sorrow
And my years with sighing;
My strength has failed because of my iniquity,
And my body has wasted away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because of all my adversaries, I have become a reproach,
Especially to my neighbors,
And an object of dread to my acquaintances;
Those who see me in the street flee from me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am forgotten as a dead man, out of mind;
I am like a broken vessel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I have heard the slander of many,
Terror is on every side;
While they took counsel together against me,
They schemed to take away my life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But as for me, I trust in You, O Lord,
I say, “You are my God.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
My times are in Your hand;
Deliver me from the hand of my enemies and from those who persecute me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make Your face to shine upon Your servant;
Save me in Your lovingkindness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let me not be put to shame, O Lord, for I call upon You;
Let the wicked be put to shame, let them be silent in Sheol.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the lying lips be mute,
Which speak arrogantly against the righteous
With pride and contempt.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How great is Your goodness,
Which You have stored up for those who fear You,
Which You have wrought for those who take refuge in You,
Before the sons of men!
speaker: Narrator

text:
You hide them in the secret place of Your presence from the conspiracies of man;
You keep them secretly in a shelter from the strife of tongues.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be the Lord,
For He has made marvelous His lovingkindness to me in a besieged city.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for me, I said in my alarm,
“I am cut off from before Your eyes”;
Nevertheless You heard the voice of my supplications
When I cried to You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O love the Lord, all you His godly ones!
The Lord preserves the faithful
And fully recompenses the proud doer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be strong and let your heart take courage,
All you who hope in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven,
Whose sin is covered!
speaker: Narrator

text:
How blessed is the man to whom the Lord does not impute iniquity,
And in whose spirit there is no deceit!
speaker: Narrator

text:
When I kept silent about my sin, my body wasted away
Through my groaning all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For day and night Your hand was heavy upon me;
My vitality was drained away as with the fever heat of summer. Selah.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Therefore, let everyone who is godly pray to You in a time when You may be found;
Surely in a flood of great waters they will not reach him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are my hiding place; You preserve me from trouble;
You surround me with songs of deliverance. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will instruct you and teach you in the way which you should go;
I will counsel you with My eye upon you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not be as the horse or as the mule which have no understanding,
Whose trappings include bit and bridle to hold them in check,
Otherwise they will not come near to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many are the sorrows of the wicked,
But he who trusts in the Lord, lovingkindness shall surround him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be glad in the Lord and rejoice, you righteous ones;
And shout for joy, all you who are upright in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing for joy in the Lord, O you righteous ones;
Praise is becoming to the upright.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord with the lyre;
Sing praises to Him with a harp of ten strings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to Him a new song;
Play skillfully with a shout of joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the word of the Lord is upright,
And all His work is done in faithfulness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He loves righteousness and justice;
The earth is full of the lovingkindness of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By the word of the Lord the heavens were made,
And by the breath of His mouth all their host.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gathers the waters of the sea together as a heap;
He lays up the deeps in storehouses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let all the earth fear the Lord;
Let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of Him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For He spoke, and it was done;
He commanded, and it stood fast.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord nullifies the counsel of the nations;
He frustrates the plans of the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The counsel of the Lord stands forever,
The plans of His heart from generation to generation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord,
The people whom He has chosen for His own inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord looks from heaven;
He sees all the sons of men;
speaker: Narrator

text:
From His dwelling place He looks out
On all the inhabitants of the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who fashions the hearts of them all,
He who understands all their works.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The king is not saved by a mighty army;
A warrior is not delivered by great strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A horse is a false hope for victory;
Nor does it deliver anyone by its great strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, the eye of the Lord is on those who fear Him,
On those who hope for His lovingkindness,
speaker: Narrator

text:
To deliver their soul from death
And to keep them alive in famine.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our soul waits for the Lord;
He is our help and our shield.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For our heart rejoices in Him,
Because we trust in His holy name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let Your lovingkindness, O Lord, be upon us,
According as we have hoped in You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will bless the Lord at all times;
His praise shall continually be in my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul will make its boast in the Lord;
The humble will hear it and rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O magnify the Lord with me,
And let us exalt His name together.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I sought the Lord, and He answered me,
And delivered me from all my fears.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They looked to Him and were radiant,
And their faces will never be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This poor man cried, and the Lord heard him
And saved him out of all his troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The angel of the Lord encamps around those who fear Him,
And rescues them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O taste and see that the Lord is good;
How blessed is the man who takes refuge in Him!
speaker: Narrator

text:
O fear the Lord, you His saints;
For to those who fear Him there is no want.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The young lions do lack and suffer hunger;
But they who seek the Lord shall not be in want of any good thing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come, you children, listen to me;
I will teach you the fear of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who is the man who desires life
And loves length of days that he may see good?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep your tongue from evil
And your lips from speaking deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Depart from evil and do good;
Seek peace and pursue it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The eyes of the Lord are toward the righteous
And His ears are open to their cry.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The face of the Lord is against evildoers,
To cut off the memory of them from the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteous cry, and the Lord hears
And delivers them out of all their troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is near to the brokenhearted
And saves those who are crushed in spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many are the afflictions of the righteous,
But the Lord delivers him out of them all.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He keeps all his bones,
Not one of them is broken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Evil shall slay the wicked,
And those who hate the righteous will be condemned.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord redeems the soul of His servants,
And none of those who take refuge in Him will be condemned.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Contend, O Lord, with those who contend with me;
Fight against those who fight against me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Take hold of buckler and shield
And rise up for my help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Draw also the spear and the battle-axe to meet those who pursue me;
Say to my soul, “I am your salvation.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let those be ashamed and dishonored who seek my life;
Let those be turned back and humiliated who devise evil against me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be like chaff before the wind,
With the angel of the Lord driving them on.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let their way be dark and slippery,
With the angel of the Lord pursuing them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For without cause they hid their net for me;
Without cause they dug a pit for my soul.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
And my soul shall rejoice in the Lord;
It shall exult in His salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All my bones will say, “Lord, who is like You,
Who delivers the afflicted from him who is too strong for him,
And the afflicted and the needy from him who robs him?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Malicious witnesses rise up;
They ask me of things that I do not know.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They repay me evil for good,
To the bereavement of my soul.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I went about as though it were my friend or brother;
I bowed down mourning, as one who sorrows for a mother.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Like godless jesters at a feast,
They gnashed at me with their teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, how long will You look on?
Rescue my soul from their ravages,
My only life from the lions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give You thanks in the great congregation;
I will praise You among a mighty throng.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not let those who are wrongfully my enemies rejoice over me;
Nor let those who hate me without cause wink maliciously.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they do not speak peace,
But they devise deceitful words against those who are quiet in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They opened their mouth wide against me;
They said, “Aha, aha, our eyes have seen it!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have seen it, O Lord, do not keep silent;
O Lord, do not be far from me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Stir up Yourself, and awake to my right
And to my cause, my God and my Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Judge me, O Lord my God, according to Your righteousness,
And do not let them rejoice over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not let them say in their heart, “Aha, our desire!”
Do not let them say, “We have swallowed him up!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let those be ashamed and humiliated altogether who rejoice at my distress;
Let those be clothed with shame and dishonor who magnify themselves over me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
And my tongue shall declare Your righteousness
And Your praise all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Transgression speaks to the ungodly within his heart;
There is no fear of God before his eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For it flatters him in his own eyes
Concerning the discovery of his iniquity and the hatred of it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The words of his mouth are wickedness and deceit;
He has ceased to be wise and to do good.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Your lovingkindness, O Lord, extends to the heavens,
Your faithfulness reaches to the skies.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
How precious is Your lovingkindness, O God!
And the children of men take refuge in the shadow of Your wings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They drink their fill of the abundance of Your house;
And You give them to drink of the river of Your delights.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For with You is the fountain of life;
In Your light we see light.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O continue Your lovingkindness to those who know You,
And Your righteousness to the upright in heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let not the foot of pride come upon me,
And let not the hand of the wicked drive me away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There the doers of iniquity have fallen;
They have been thrust down and cannot rise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not fret because of evildoers,
Be not envious toward wrongdoers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they will wither quickly like the grass
And fade like the green herb.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Trust in the Lord and do good;
Dwell in the land and cultivate faithfulness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Delight yourself in the Lord;
And He will give you the desires of your heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Commit your way to the Lord,
Trust also in Him, and He will do it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will bring forth your righteousness as the light
And your judgment as the noonday.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Cease from anger and forsake wrath;
Do not fret; it leads only to evildoing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For evildoers will be cut off,
But those who wait for the Lord, they will inherit the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet a little while and the wicked man will be no more;
And you will look carefully for his place and he will not be there.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the humble will inherit the land
And will delight themselves in abundant prosperity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked plots against the righteous
And gnashes at him with his teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord laughs at him,
For He sees his day is coming.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked have drawn the sword and bent their bow
To cast down the afflicted and the needy,
To slay those who are upright in conduct.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their sword will enter their own heart,
And their bows will be broken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Better is the little of the righteous
Than the abundance of many wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the arms of the wicked will be broken,
But the Lord sustains the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord knows the days of the blameless,
And their inheritance will be forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will not be ashamed in the time of evil,
And in the days of famine they will have abundance.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The wicked borrows and does not pay back,
But the righteous is gracious and gives.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For those blessed by Him will inherit the land,
But those cursed by Him will be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The steps of a man are established by the Lord,
And He delights in his way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When he falls, he will not be hurled headlong,
Because the Lord is the One who holds his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have been young and now I am old,
Yet I have not seen the righteous forsaken
Or his descendants begging bread.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All day long he is gracious and lends,
And his descendants are a blessing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Depart from evil and do good,
So you will abide forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord loves justice
And does not forsake His godly ones;
They are preserved forever,
But the descendants of the wicked will be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The righteous will inherit the land
And dwell in it forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mouth of the righteous utters wisdom,
And his tongue speaks justice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The law of his God is in his heart;
His steps do not slip.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked spies upon the righteous
And seeks to kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will not leave him in his hand
Or let him be condemned when he is judged.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I have seen a wicked, violent man
Spreading himself like a luxuriant tree in its native soil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then he passed away, and lo, he was no more;
I sought for him, but he could not be found.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Mark the blameless man, and behold the upright;
For the man of peace will have a posterity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But transgressors will be altogether destroyed;
The posterity of the wicked will be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the salvation of the righteous is from the Lord;
He is their strength in time of trouble.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
O Lord, rebuke me not in Your wrath,
And chasten me not in Your burning anger.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Your arrows have sunk deep into me,
And Your hand has pressed down on me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is no soundness in my flesh because of Your indignation;
There is no health in my bones because of my sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For my iniquities are gone over my head;
As a heavy burden they weigh too much for me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My wounds grow foul and fester
Because of my folly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am bent over and greatly bowed down;
I go mourning all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For my loins are filled with burning,
And there is no soundness in my flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am benumbed and badly crushed;
I groan because of the agitation of my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, all my desire is before You;
And my sighing is not hidden from You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My heart throbs, my strength fails me;
And the light of my eyes, even that has gone from me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My loved ones and my friends stand aloof from my plague;
And my kinsmen stand afar off.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
But I, like a deaf man, do not hear;
And I am like a mute man who does not open his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yes, I am like a man who does not hear,
And in whose mouth are no arguments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I hope in You, O Lord;
You will answer, O Lord my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I said, “May they not rejoice over me,
Who, when my foot slips, would magnify themselves against me.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I am ready to fall,
And my sorrow is continually before me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I confess my iniquity;
I am full of anxiety because of my sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But my enemies are vigorous and strong,
And many are those who hate me wrongfully.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And those who repay evil for good,
They oppose me, because I follow what is good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not forsake me, O Lord;
O my God, do not be far from me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make haste to help me,
O Lord, my salvation!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said, “I will guard my ways
That I may not sin with my tongue;
I will guard my mouth as with a muzzle
While the wicked are in my presence.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was mute and silent,
I refrained even from good,
And my sorrow grew worse.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
“And now, Lord, for what do I wait?
My hope is in You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Deliver me from all my transgressions;
Make me not the reproach of the foolish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I have become mute, I do not open my mouth,
Because it is You who have done it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Remove Your plague from me;
Because of the opposition of Your hand I am perishing.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
“Turn Your gaze away from me, that I may smile again
Before I depart and am no more.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I waited patiently for the Lord;
And He inclined to me and heard my cry.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He brought me up out of the pit of destruction, out of the miry clay,
And He set my feet upon a rock making my footsteps firm.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
How blessed is the man who has made the Lord his trust,
And has not turned to the proud, nor to those who lapse into falsehood.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many, O Lord my God, are the wonders which You have done,
And Your thoughts toward us;
There is none to compare with You.
If I would declare and speak of them,
They would be too numerous to count.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Then I said, “Behold, I come;
In the scroll of the book it is written of me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I delight to do Your will, O my God;
Your Law is within my heart.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
You, O Lord, will not withhold Your compassion from me;
Your lovingkindness and Your truth will continually preserve me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Be pleased, O Lord, to deliver me;
Make haste, O Lord, to help me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let those be ashamed and humiliated together
Who seek my life to destroy it;
Let those be turned back and dishonored
Who delight in my hurt.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let those be appalled because of their shame
Who say to me, “Aha, aha!”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Since I am afflicted and needy,
Let the Lord be mindful of me.
You are my help and my deliverer;
Do not delay, O my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How blessed is he who considers the helpless;
The Lord will deliver him in a day of trouble.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The Lord will sustain him upon his sickbed;
In his illness, You restore him to health.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for me, I said, “O Lord, be gracious to me;
Heal my soul, for I have sinned against You.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
My enemies speak evil against me,
“When will he die, and his name perish?”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
All who hate me whisper together against me;
Against me they devise my hurt, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“A wicked thing is poured out upon him,
That when he lies down, he will not rise up again.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even my close friend in whom I trusted,
Who ate my bread,
Has lifted up his heel against me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But You, O Lord, be gracious to me and raise me up,
That I may repay them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By this I know that You are pleased with me,
Because my enemy does not shout in triumph over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for me, You uphold me in my integrity,
And You set me in Your presence forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel,
From everlasting to everlasting.
Amen and Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As the deer pants for the water brooks,
So my soul pants for You, O God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul thirsts for God, for the living God;
When shall I come and appear before God?
speaker: Narrator

text:
My tears have been my food day and night,
While they say to me all day long, “Where is your God?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
These things I remember and I pour out my soul within me.
For I used to go along with the throng and lead them in procession to the house of God,
With the voice of joy and thanksgiving, a multitude keeping festival.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why are you in despair, O my soul?
And why have you become disturbed within me?
Hope in God, for I shall again praise Him
For the help of His presence.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Deep calls to deep at the sound of Your waterfalls;
All Your breakers and Your waves have rolled over me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I will say to God my rock, “Why have You forgotten me?
Why do I go mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
As a shattering of my bones, my adversaries revile me,
While they say to me all day long, “Where is your God?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why are you in despair, O my soul?
And why have you become disturbed within me?
Hope in God, for I shall yet praise Him,
The help of my countenance and my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Vindicate me, O God, and plead my case against an ungodly nation;
O deliver me from the deceitful and unjust man!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For You are the God of my strength; why have You rejected me?
Why do I go mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Why are you in despair, O my soul?
And why are you disturbed within me?
Hope in God, for I shall again praise Him,
The help of my countenance and my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O God, we have heard with our ears,
Our fathers have told us
The work that You did in their days,
In the days of old.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For by their own sword they did not possess the land,
And their own arm did not save them,
But Your right hand and Your arm and the light of Your presence,
For You favored them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are my King, O God;
Command victories for Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Through You we will push back our adversaries;
Through Your name we will trample down those who rise up against us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I will not trust in my bow,
Nor will my sword save me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But You have saved us from our adversaries,
And You have put to shame those who hate us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In God we have boasted all day long,
And we will give thanks to Your name forever. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet You have rejected us and brought us to dishonor,
And do not go out with our armies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You cause us to turn back from the adversary;
And those who hate us have taken spoil for themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You give us as sheep to be eaten
And have scattered us among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You sell Your people cheaply,
And have not profited by their sale.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You make us a reproach to our neighbors,
A scoffing and a derision to those around us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You make us a byword among the nations,
A laughingstock among the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All day long my dishonor is before me
And my humiliation has overwhelmed me,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because of the voice of him who reproaches and reviles,
Because of the presence of the enemy and the avenger.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All this has come upon us, but we have not forgotten You,
And we have not dealt falsely with Your covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our heart has not turned back,
And our steps have not deviated from Your way,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet You have crushed us in a place of jackals
And covered us with the shadow of death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If we had forgotten the name of our God
Or extended our hands to a strange god,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Would not God find this out?
For He knows the secrets of the heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But for Your sake we are killed all day long;
We are considered as sheep to be slaughtered.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arouse Yourself, why do You sleep, O Lord?
Awake, do not reject us forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why do You hide Your face
And forget our affliction and our oppression?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For our soul has sunk down into the dust;
Our body cleaves to the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rise up, be our help,
And redeem us for the sake of Your lovingkindness.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Gird Your sword on Your thigh, O Mighty One,
In Your splendor and Your majesty!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Your throne, O God, is forever and ever;
A scepter of uprightness is the scepter of Your kingdom.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
All Your garments are fragrant with myrrh and aloes and cassia;
Out of ivory palaces stringed instruments have made You glad.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Kings’ daughters are among Your noble ladies;
At Your right hand stands the queen in gold from Ophir.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen, O daughter, give attention and incline your ear:
Forget your people and your father’s house;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the King will desire your beauty.
Because He is your Lord, bow down to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The daughter of Tyre will come with a gift;
The rich among the people will seek your favor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The King’s daughter is all glorious within;
Her clothing is interwoven with gold.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
They will be led forth with gladness and rejoicing;
They will enter into the King’s palace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In place of your fathers will be your sons;
You shall make them princes in all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will cause Your name to be remembered in all generations;
Therefore the peoples will give You thanks forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God is our refuge and strength,
A very present help in trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore we will not fear, though the earth should change
And though the mountains slip into the heart of the sea;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though its waters roar and foam,
Though the mountains quake at its swelling pride. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is a river whose streams make glad the city of God,
The holy dwelling places of the Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God is in the midst of her, she will not be moved;
God will help her when morning dawns.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The nations made an uproar, the kingdoms tottered;
He raised His voice, the earth melted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord of hosts is with us;
The God of Jacob is our stronghold. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come, behold the works of the Lord,
Who has wrought desolations in the earth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“Cease striving and know that I am God;
I will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted in the earth.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord of hosts is with us;
The God of Jacob is our stronghold. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O clap your hands, all peoples;
Shout to God with the voice of joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord Most High is to be feared,
A great King over all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He subdues peoples under us
And nations under our feet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He chooses our inheritance for us,
The glory of Jacob whom He loves. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God has ascended with a shout,
The Lord, with the sound of a trumpet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing praises to God, sing praises;
Sing praises to our King, sing praises.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For God is the King of all the earth;
Sing praises with a skillful psalm.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God reigns over the nations,
God sits on His holy throne.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised,
In the city of our God, His holy mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Beautiful in elevation, the joy of the whole earth,
Is Mount Zion in the far north,
The city of the great King.
speaker: Narrator

text:
God, in her palaces,
Has made Himself known as a stronghold.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For, lo, the kings assembled themselves,
They passed by together.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They saw it, then they were amazed;
They were terrified, they fled in alarm.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Panic seized them there,
Anguish, as of a woman in childbirth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With the east wind
You break the ships of Tarshish.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
We have thought on Your lovingkindness, O God,
In the midst of Your temple.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Let Mount Zion be glad,
Let the daughters of Judah rejoice
Because of Your judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Walk about Zion and go around her;
Count her towers;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Hear this, all peoples;
Give ear, all inhabitants of the world,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Both low and high,
Rich and poor together.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My mouth will speak wisdom,
And the meditation of my heart will be understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will incline my ear to a proverb;
I will express my riddle on the harp.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why should I fear in days of adversity,
When the iniquity of my foes surrounds me,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even those who trust in their wealth
And boast in the abundance of their riches?
speaker: Narrator

text:
No man can by any means redeem his brother
Or give to God a ransom for him—
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the redemption of his soul is costly,
And he should cease trying forever—
speaker: Narrator

text:
That he should live on eternally,
That he should not undergo decay.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
But man in his pomp will not endure;
He is like the beasts that perish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the way of those who are foolish,
And of those after them who approve their words. Selah.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
But God will redeem my soul from the power of Sheol,
For He will receive me. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not be afraid when a man becomes rich,
When the glory of his house is increased;
speaker: Narrator

text:
For when he dies he will carry nothing away;
His glory will not descend after him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though while he lives he congratulates himself—
And though men praise you when you do well for yourself—
speaker: Narrator

text:
He shall go to the generation of his fathers;
They will never see the light.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Man in his pomp, yet without understanding,
Is like the beasts that perish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Mighty One, God, the Lord, has spoken,
And summoned the earth from the rising of the sun to its setting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty,
God has shone forth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
He summons the heavens above,
And the earth, to judge His people:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Gather My godly ones to Me,
Those who have made a covenant with Me by sacrifice.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the heavens declare His righteousness,
For God Himself is judge. Selah.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“I do not reprove you for your sacrifices,
And your burnt offerings are continually before Me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I shall take no young bull out of your house
Nor male goats out of your folds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“For every beast of the forest is Mine,
The cattle on a thousand hills.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I know every bird of the mountains,
And everything that moves in the field is Mine.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“If I were hungry I would not tell you,
For the world is Mine, and all it contains.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Shall I eat the flesh of bulls
Or drink the blood of male goats?
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Offer to God a sacrifice of thanksgiving
And pay your vows to the Most High;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Call upon Me in the day of trouble;
I shall rescue you, and you will honor Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But to the wicked God says,
“What right have you to tell of My statutes
And to take My covenant in your mouth?
speaker: Narrator

text:
“For you hate discipline,
And you cast My words behind you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“When you see a thief, you are pleased with him,
And you associate with adulterers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“You let your mouth loose in evil
And your tongue frames deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“You sit and speak against your brother;
You slander your own mother’s son.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“Now consider this, you who forget God,
Or I will tear you in pieces, and there will be none to deliver.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Be gracious to me, O God, according to Your lovingkindness;
According to the greatness of Your compassion blot out my transgressions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity
And cleanse me from my sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I know my transgressions,
And my sin is ever before me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Against You, You only, I have sinned
And done what is evil in Your sight,
So that You are justified when You speak
And blameless when You judge.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, I was brought forth in iniquity,
And in sin my mother conceived me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, You desire truth in the innermost being,
And in the hidden part You will make me know wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Purify me with hyssop, and I shall be clean;
Wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make me to hear joy and gladness,
Let the bones which You have broken rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hide Your face from my sins
And blot out all my iniquities.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Create in me a clean heart, O God,
And renew a steadfast spirit within me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not cast me away from Your presence
And do not take Your Holy Spirit from me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Restore to me the joy of Your salvation
And sustain me with a willing spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I will teach transgressors Your ways,
And sinners will be converted to You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, the God of my salvation;
Then my tongue will joyfully sing of Your righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, open my lips,
That my mouth may declare Your praise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For You do not delight in sacrifice, otherwise I would give it;
You are not pleased with burnt offering.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit;
A broken and a contrite heart, O God, You will not despise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By Your favor do good to Zion;
Build the walls of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Why do you boast in evil, O mighty man?
The lovingkindness of God endures all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your tongue devises destruction,
Like a sharp razor, O worker of deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You love evil more than good,
Falsehood more than speaking what is right. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You love all words that devour,
O deceitful tongue.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The righteous will see and fear,
And will laugh at him, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Behold, the man who would not make God his refuge,
But trusted in the abundance of his riches
And was strong in his evil desire.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But as for me, I am like a green olive tree in the house of God;
I trust in the lovingkindness of God forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give You thanks forever, because You have done it,
And I will wait on Your name, for it is good, in the presence of Your godly ones.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
God has looked down from heaven upon the sons of men
To see if there is anyone who understands,
Who seeks after God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Every one of them has turned aside; together they have become corrupt;
There is no one who does good, not even one.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have the workers of wickedness no knowledge,
Who eat up My people as though they ate bread
And have not called upon God?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Oh, that the salvation of Israel would come out of Zion!
When God restores His captive people,
Let Jacob rejoice, let Israel be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Save me, O God, by Your name,
And vindicate me by Your power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear my prayer, O God;
Give ear to the words of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Behold, God is my helper;
The Lord is the sustainer of my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will recompense the evil to my foes;
Destroy them in Your faithfulness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Willingly I will sacrifice to You;
I will give thanks to Your name, O Lord, for it is good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For He has delivered me from all trouble,
And my eye has looked with satisfaction upon my enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give ear to my prayer, O God;
And do not hide Yourself from my supplication.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give heed to me and answer me;
I am restless in my complaint and am surely distracted,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because of the voice of the enemy,
Because of the pressure of the wicked;
For they bring down trouble upon me
And in anger they bear a grudge against me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My heart is in anguish within me,
And the terrors of death have fallen upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fear and trembling come upon me,
And horror has overwhelmed me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said, “Oh, that I had wings like a dove!
I would fly away and be at rest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Behold, I would wander far away,
I would lodge in the wilderness. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I would hasten to my place of refuge
From the stormy wind and tempest.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
