And the heavens are the work of Your hands.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“But You are the same,
And Your years will not come to an end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“The children of Your servants will continue,
And their descendants will be established before You.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bless the Lord, O my soul,
And all that is within me, bless His holy name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bless the Lord, O my soul,
And forget none of His benefits;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who pardons all your iniquities,
Who heals all your diseases;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who redeems your life from the pit,
Who crowns you with lovingkindness and compassion;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who satisfies your years with good things,
So that your youth is renewed like the eagle.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord performs righteous deeds
And judgments for all who are oppressed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He made known His ways to Moses,
His acts to the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is compassionate and gracious,
Slow to anger and abounding in lovingkindness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will not always strive with us,
Nor will He keep His anger forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has not dealt with us according to our sins,
Nor rewarded us according to our iniquities.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For as high as the heavens are above the earth,
So great is His lovingkindness toward those who fear Him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As far as the east is from the west,
So far has He removed our transgressions from us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Just as a father has compassion on his children,
So the Lord has compassion on those who fear Him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For He Himself knows our frame;
He is mindful that we are but dust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for man, his days are like grass;
As a flower of the field, so he flourishes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When the wind has passed over it, it is no more,
And its place acknowledges it no longer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the lovingkindness of the Lord is from everlasting to everlasting on those who fear Him,
And His righteousness to children’s children,
speaker: Narrator

text:
To those who keep His covenant
And remember His precepts to do them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has established His throne in the heavens,
And His sovereignty rules over all.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bless the Lord, you His angels,
Mighty in strength, who perform His word,
Obeying the voice of His word!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bless the Lord, all you His hosts,
You who serve Him, doing His will.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Covering Yourself with light as with a cloak,
Stretching out heaven like a tent curtain.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
He makes the winds His messengers,
Flaming fire His ministers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He established the earth upon its foundations,
So that it will not totter forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You covered it with the deep as with a garment;
The waters were standing above the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text:
At Your rebuke they fled,
At the sound of Your thunder they hurried away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mountains rose; the valleys sank down
To the place which You established for them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You set a boundary that they may not pass over,
So that they will not return to cover the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sends forth springs in the valleys;
They flow between the mountains;
speaker: Narrator

text:
They give drink to every beast of the field;
The wild donkeys quench their thirst.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Beside them the birds of the heavens dwell;
They lift up their voices among the branches.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He waters the mountains from His upper chambers;
The earth is satisfied with the fruit of His works.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He causes the grass to grow for the cattle,
And vegetation for the labor of man,
So that he may bring forth food from the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And wine which makes man’s heart glad,
So that he may make his face glisten with oil,
And food which sustains man’s heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The trees of the Lord drink their fill,
The cedars of Lebanon which He planted,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Where the birds build their nests,
And the stork, whose home is the fir trees.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The high mountains are for the wild goats;
The cliffs are a refuge for the shephanim.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He made the moon for the seasons;
The sun knows the place of its setting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You appoint darkness and it becomes night,
In which all the beasts of the forest prowl about.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The young lions roar after their prey
And seek their food from God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When the sun rises they withdraw
And lie down in their dens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Man goes forth to his work
And to his labor until evening.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
There is the sea, great and broad,
In which are swarms without number,
Animals both small and great.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There the ships move along,
And Leviathan, which You have formed to sport in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They all wait for You
To give them their food in due season.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You give to them, they gather it up;
You open Your hand, they are satisfied with good.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
You send forth Your Spirit, they are created;
And You renew the face of the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the glory of the Lord endure forever;
Let the Lord be glad in His works;
speaker: Narrator

text:
He looks at the earth, and it trembles;
He touches the mountains, and they smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will sing to the Lord as long as I live;
I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my meditation be pleasing to Him;
As for me, I shall be glad in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let sinners be consumed from the earth
And let the wicked be no more.
Bless the Lord, O my soul.
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh give thanks to the Lord, call upon His name;
Make known His deeds among the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to Him, sing praises to Him;
Speak of all His wonders.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Glory in His holy name;
Let the heart of those who seek the Lord be glad.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seek the Lord and His strength;
Seek His face continually.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember His wonders which He has done,
His marvels and the judgments uttered by His mouth,
speaker: Narrator

text:
O seed of Abraham, His servant,
O sons of Jacob, His chosen ones!
speaker: Narrator

text:
He is the Lord our God;
His judgments are in all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has remembered His covenant forever,
The word which He commanded to a thousand generations,
speaker: Narrator

text:
The covenant which He made with Abraham,
And His oath to Isaac.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then He confirmed it to Jacob for a statute,
To Israel as an everlasting covenant,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan
As the portion of your inheritance,”
speaker: Narrator

text:
When they were only a few men in number,
Very few, and strangers in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And they wandered about from nation to nation,
From one kingdom to another people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He permitted no man to oppress them,
And He reproved kings for their sakes:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Do not touch My anointed ones,
And do My prophets no harm.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And He called for a famine upon the land;
He broke the whole staff of bread.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent a man before them,
Joseph, who was sold as a slave.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They afflicted his feet with fetters,
He himself was laid in irons;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Until the time that his word came to pass,
The word of the Lord tested him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The king sent and released him,
The ruler of peoples, and set him free.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He made him lord of his house
And ruler over all his possessions,
speaker: Narrator

text:
To imprison his princes at will,
That he might teach his elders wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Israel also came into Egypt;
Thus Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And He caused His people to be very fruitful,
And made them stronger than their adversaries.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He turned their heart to hate His people,
To deal craftily with His servants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent Moses His servant,
And Aaron, whom He had chosen.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They performed His wondrous acts among them,
And miracles in the land of Ham.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent darkness and made it dark;
And they did not rebel against His words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He turned their waters into blood
And caused their fish to die.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their land swarmed with frogs
Even in the chambers of their kings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He spoke, and there came a swarm of flies
And gnats in all their territory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gave them hail for rain,
And flaming fire in their land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He struck down their vines also and their fig trees,
And shattered the trees of their territory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He spoke, and locusts came,
And young locusts, even without number,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And ate up all vegetation in their land,
And ate up the fruit of their ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He also struck down all the firstborn in their land,
The first fruits of all their vigor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then He brought them out with silver and gold,
And among His tribes there was not one who stumbled.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Egypt was glad when they departed,
For the dread of them had fallen upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He spread a cloud for a covering,
And fire to illumine by night.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They asked, and He brought quail,
And satisfied them with the bread of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He opened the rock and water flowed out;
It ran in the dry places like a river.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For He remembered His holy word
With Abraham His servant;
speaker: Narrator

text:
And He brought forth His people with joy,
His chosen ones with a joyful shout.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gave them also the lands of the nations,
That they might take possession of the fruit of the peoples’ labor,
speaker: Narrator

text:
So that they might keep His statutes
And observe His laws,
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Who can speak of the mighty deeds of the Lord,
Or can show forth all His praise?
speaker: Narrator

text:
How blessed are those who keep justice,
Who practice righteousness at all times!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember me, O Lord, in Your favor toward Your people;
Visit me with Your salvation,
speaker: Narrator

text:
That I may see the prosperity of Your chosen ones,
That I may rejoice in the gladness of Your nation,
That I may glory with Your inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
We have sinned like our fathers,
We have committed iniquity, we have behaved wickedly.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Nevertheless He saved them for the sake of His name,
That He might make His power known.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus He rebuked the Red Sea and it dried up,
And He led them through the deeps, as through the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So He saved them from the hand of the one who hated them,
And redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The waters covered their adversaries;
Not one of them was left.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they believed His words;
They sang His praise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They quickly forgot His works;
They did not wait for His counsel,
speaker: Narrator

text:
But craved intensely in the wilderness,
And tempted God in the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So He gave them their request,
But sent a wasting disease among them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When they became envious of Moses in the camp,
And of Aaron, the holy one of the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text:
The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan,
And engulfed the company of Abiram.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And a fire blazed up in their company;
The flame consumed the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They made a calf in Horeb
And worshiped a molten image.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus they exchanged their glory
For the image of an ox that eats grass.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They forgot God their Savior,
Who had done great things in Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wonders in the land of Ham
And awesome things by the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore He said that He would destroy them,
Had not Moses His chosen one stood in the breach before Him,
To turn away His wrath from destroying them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they despised the pleasant land;
They did not believe in His word,
speaker: Narrator

text:
But grumbled in their tents;
They did not listen to the voice of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore He swore to them
That He would cast them down in the wilderness,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And that He would cast their seed among the nations
And scatter them in the lands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They joined themselves also to Baal-peor,
And ate sacrifices offered to the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus they provoked Him to anger with their deeds,
And the plague broke out among them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Phinehas stood up and interposed,
And so the plague was stayed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And it was reckoned to him for righteousness,
To all generations forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They also provoked Him to wrath at the waters of Meribah,
So that it went hard with Moses on their account;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because they were rebellious against His Spirit,
He spoke rashly with his lips.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They did not destroy the peoples,
As the Lord commanded them,
speaker: Narrator

text:
But they mingled with the nations
And learned their practices,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And served their idols,
Which became a snare to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They even sacrificed their sons and their daughters to the demons,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And shed innocent blood,
The blood of their sons and their daughters,
Whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan;
And the land was polluted with the blood.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus they became unclean in their practices,
And played the harlot in their deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore the anger of the Lord was kindled against His people
And He abhorred His inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then He gave them into the hand of the nations,
And those who hated them ruled over them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their enemies also oppressed them,
And they were subdued under their power.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Nevertheless He looked upon their distress
When He heard their cry;
speaker: Narrator

text:
And He remembered His covenant for their sake,
And relented according to the greatness of His lovingkindness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He also made them objects of compassion
In the presence of all their captors.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Save us, O Lord our God,
And gather us from among the nations,
To give thanks to Your holy name
And glory in Your praise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel,
From everlasting even to everlasting.
And let all the people say, “Amen.”
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh give thanks to the Lord, for He is good,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the redeemed of the Lord say so,
Whom He has redeemed from the hand of the adversary
speaker: Narrator

text:
And gathered from the lands,
From the east and from the west,
From the north and from the south.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They wandered in the wilderness in a desert region;
They did not find a way to an inhabited city.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They were hungry and thirsty;
Their soul fainted within them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble;
He delivered them out of their distresses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He led them also by a straight way,
To go to an inhabited city.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them give thanks to the Lord for His lovingkindness,
And for His wonders to the sons of men!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For He has satisfied the thirsty soul,
And the hungry soul He has filled with what is good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There were those who dwelt in darkness and in the shadow of death,
Prisoners in misery and chains,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because they had rebelled against the words of God
And spurned the counsel of the Most High.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore He humbled their heart with labor;
They stumbled and there was none to help.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble;
He saved them out of their distresses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death
And broke their bands apart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them give thanks to the Lord for His lovingkindness,
And for His wonders to the sons of men!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For He has shattered gates of bronze
And cut bars of iron asunder.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fools, because of their rebellious way,
And because of their iniquities, were afflicted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their soul abhorred all kinds of food,
And they drew near to the gates of death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble;
He saved them out of their distresses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent His word and healed them,
And delivered them from their destructions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them give thanks to the Lord for His lovingkindness,
And for His wonders to the sons of men!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them also offer sacrifices of thanksgiving,
And tell of His works with joyful singing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who go down to the sea in ships,
Who do business on great waters;
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have seen the works of the Lord,
And His wonders in the deep.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For He spoke and raised up a stormy wind,
Which lifted up the waves of the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They rose up to the heavens, they went down to the depths;
Their soul melted away in their misery.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They reeled and staggered like a drunken man,
And were at their wits’ end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they cried to the Lord in their trouble,
And He brought them out of their distresses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He caused the storm to be still,
So that the waves of the sea were hushed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they were glad because they were quiet,
So He guided them to their desired haven.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them give thanks to the Lord for His lovingkindness,
And for His wonders to the sons of men!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them extol Him also in the congregation of the people,
And praise Him at the seat of the elders.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He changes rivers into a wilderness
And springs of water into a thirsty ground;
speaker: Narrator

text:
A fruitful land into a salt waste,
Because of the wickedness of those who dwell in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He changes a wilderness into a pool of water
And a dry land into springs of water;
speaker: Narrator

text:
And there He makes the hungry to dwell,
So that they may establish an inhabited city,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And sow fields and plant vineyards,
And gather a fruitful harvest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Also He blesses them and they multiply greatly,
And He does not let their cattle decrease.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When they are diminished and bowed down
Through oppression, misery and sorrow,
speaker: Narrator

text:
He pours contempt upon princes
And makes them wander in a pathless waste.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But He sets the needy securely on high away from affliction,
And makes his families like a flock.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The upright see it and are glad;
But all unrighteousness shuts its mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who is wise? Let him give heed to these things,
And consider the lovingkindnesses of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My heart is steadfast, O God;
I will sing, I will sing praises, even with my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Awake, harp and lyre;
I will awaken the dawn!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give thanks to You, O Lord, among the peoples,
And I will sing praises to You among the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Your lovingkindness is great above the heavens,
And Your truth reaches to the skies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be exalted, O God, above the heavens,
And Your glory above all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
That Your beloved may be delivered,
Save with Your right hand, and answer me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
God has spoken in His holiness:
“I will exult, I will portion out Shechem
And measure out the valley of Succoth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Who will bring me into the besieged city?
Who will lead me to Edom?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have not You Yourself, O God, rejected us?
And will You not go forth with our armies, O God?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh give us help against the adversary,
For deliverance by man is in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Through God we will do valiantly,
And it is He who shall tread down our adversaries.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O God of my praise,
Do not be silent!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they have opened the wicked and deceitful mouth against me;
They have spoken against me with a lying tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have also surrounded me with words of hatred,
And fought against me without cause.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In return for my love they act as my accusers;
But I am in prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus they have repaid me evil for good
And hatred for my love.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Appoint a wicked man over him,
And let an accuser stand at his right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When he is judged, let him come forth guilty,
And let his prayer become sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let his days be few;
Let another take his office.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let his children be fatherless
And his wife a widow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let his children wander about and beg;
And let them seek sustenance far from their ruined homes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the creditor seize all that he has,
And let strangers plunder the product of his labor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let there be none to extend lovingkindness to him,
Nor any to be gracious to his fatherless children.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let his posterity be cut off;
In a following generation let their name be blotted out.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered before the Lord,
And do not let the sin of his mother be blotted out.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be before the Lord continually,
That He may cut off their memory from the earth;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because he did not remember to show lovingkindness,
But persecuted the afflicted and needy man,
And the despondent in heart, to put them to death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He also loved cursing, so it came to him;
And he did not delight in blessing, so it was far from him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But he clothed himself with cursing as with his garment,
And it entered into his body like water
And like oil into his bones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let it be to him as a garment with which he covers himself,
And for a belt with which he constantly girds himself.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let this be the reward of my accusers from the Lord,
And of those who speak evil against my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But You, O God, the Lord, deal kindly with me for Your name’s sake;
Because Your lovingkindness is good, deliver me;
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I am afflicted and needy,
And my heart is wounded within me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am passing like a shadow when it lengthens;
I am shaken off like the locust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My knees are weak from fasting,
And my flesh has grown lean, without fatness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I also have become a reproach to them;
When they see me, they wag their head.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Help me, O Lord my God;
Save me according to Your lovingkindness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And let them know that this is Your hand;
You, Lord, have done it.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Let my accusers be clothed with dishonor,
And let them cover themselves with their own shame as with a robe.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With my mouth I will give thanks abundantly to the Lord;
And in the midst of many I will praise Him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For He stands at the right hand of the needy,
To save him from those who judge his soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord says to my Lord:
“Sit at My right hand
Until I make Your enemies a footstool for Your feet.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will stretch forth Your strong scepter from Zion, saying,
“Rule in the midst of Your enemies.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The Lord has sworn and will not change His mind,
“You are a priest forever
According to the order of Melchizedek.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is at Your right hand;
He will shatter kings in the day of His wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will judge among the nations,
He will fill them with corpses,
He will shatter the chief men over a broad country.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will drink from the brook by the wayside;
Therefore He will lift up His head.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord!
I will give thanks to the Lord with all my heart,
In the company of the upright and in the assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Great are the works of the Lord;
They are studied by all who delight in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Splendid and majestic is His work,
And His righteousness endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has made His wonders to be remembered;
The Lord is gracious and compassionate.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has given food to those who fear Him;
He will remember His covenant forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has made known to His people the power of His works,
In giving them the heritage of the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The works of His hands are truth and justice;
All His precepts are sure.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are upheld forever and ever;
They are performed in truth and uprightness.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord!
How blessed is the man who fears the Lord,
Who greatly delights in His commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His descendants will be mighty on earth;
The generation of the upright will be blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wealth and riches are in his house,
And his righteousness endures forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Light arises in the darkness for the upright;
He is gracious and compassionate and righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is well with the man who is gracious and lends;
He will maintain his cause in judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For he will never be shaken;
The righteous will be remembered forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will not fear evil tidings;
His heart is steadfast, trusting in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His heart is upheld, he will not fear,
Until he looks with satisfaction on his adversaries.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord!
Praise, O servants of the Lord,
Praise the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be the name of the Lord
From this time forth and forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
From the rising of the sun to its setting
The name of the Lord is to be praised.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is high above all nations;
His glory is above the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who is like the Lord our God,
Who is enthroned on high,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who humbles Himself to behold
The things that are in heaven and in the earth?
speaker: Narrator

text:
He raises the poor from the dust
And lifts the needy from the ash heap,
speaker: Narrator

text:
To make them sit with princes,
With the princes of His people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He makes the barren woman abide in the house
As a joyful mother of children.
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
When Israel went forth from Egypt,
The house of Jacob from a people of strange language,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Judah became His sanctuary,
Israel, His dominion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sea looked and fled;
The Jordan turned back.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mountains skipped like rams,
The hills, like lambs.
speaker: Narrator

text:
What ails you, O sea, that you flee?
O Jordan, that you turn back?
speaker: Narrator

text:
O mountains, that you skip like rams?
O hills, like lambs?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Tremble, O earth, before the Lord,
Before the God of Jacob,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who turned the rock into a pool of water,
The flint into a fountain of water.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Not to us, O Lord, not to us,
But to Your name give glory
Because of Your lovingkindness, because of Your truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why should the nations say,
“Where, now, is their God?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But our God is in the heavens;
He does whatever He pleases.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their idols are silver and gold,
The work of man’s hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have mouths, but they cannot speak;
They have eyes, but they cannot see;
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have ears, but they cannot hear;
They have noses, but they cannot smell;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Those who make them will become like them,
Everyone who trusts in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Israel, trust in the Lord;
He is their help and their shield.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O house of Aaron, trust in the Lord;
He is their help and their shield.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You who fear the Lord, trust in the Lord;
He is their help and their shield.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
He will bless those who fear the Lord,
The small together with the great.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the Lord give you increase,
You and your children.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May you be blessed of the Lord,
Maker of heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The heavens are the heavens of the Lord,
But the earth He has given to the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The dead do not praise the Lord,
Nor do any who go down into silence;
speaker: Narrator

text:
But as for us, we will bless the Lord
From this time forth and forever.
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I love the Lord, because He hears
My voice and my supplications.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because He has inclined His ear to me,
Therefore I shall call upon Him as long as I live.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Then I called upon the name of the Lord:
“O Lord, I beseech You, save my life!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Gracious is the Lord, and righteous;
Yes, our God is compassionate.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord preserves the simple;
I was brought low, and He saved me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Return to your rest, O my soul,
For the Lord has dealt bountifully with you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For You have rescued my soul from death,
My eyes from tears,
My feet from stumbling.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I shall walk before the Lord
In the land of the living.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I believed when I said,
“I am greatly afflicted.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I said in my alarm,
“All men are liars.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
What shall I render to the Lord
For all His benefits toward me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
I shall lift up the cup of salvation
And call upon the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I shall pay my vows to the Lord,
Oh may it be in the presence of all His people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Precious in the sight of the Lord
Is the death of His godly ones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, surely I am Your servant,
I am Your servant, the son of Your handmaid,
You have loosed my bonds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To You I shall offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving,
And call upon the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I shall pay my vows to the Lord,
Oh may it be in the presence of all His people,
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the courts of the Lord’s house,
In the midst of you, O Jerusalem.
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, all nations;
Laud Him, all peoples!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For His lovingkindness is great toward us,
And the truth of the Lord is everlasting.
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good;
For His lovingkindness is everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh let Israel say,
“His lovingkindness is everlasting.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh let the house of Aaron say,
“His lovingkindness is everlasting.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh let those who fear the Lord say,
“His lovingkindness is everlasting.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
From my distress I called upon the Lord;
The Lord answered me and set me in a large place.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is for me; I will not fear;
What can man do to me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is for me among those who help me;
Therefore I will look with satisfaction on those who hate me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is better to take refuge in the Lord
Than to trust in man.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is better to take refuge in the Lord
Than to trust in princes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All nations surrounded me;
In the name of the Lord I will surely cut them off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They surrounded me, yes, they surrounded me;
In the name of the Lord I will surely cut them off.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
You pushed me violently so that I was falling,
But the Lord helped me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is my strength and song,
And He has become my salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sound of joyful shouting and salvation is in the tents of the righteous;
The right hand of the Lord does valiantly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The right hand of the Lord is exalted;
The right hand of the Lord does valiantly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will not die, but live,
And tell of the works of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has disciplined me severely,
But He has not given me over to death.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Open to me the gates of righteousness;
I shall enter through them, I shall give thanks to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the gate of the Lord;
The righteous will enter through it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I shall give thanks to You, for You have answered me,
And You have become my salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The stone which the builders rejected
Has become the chief corner stone.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the Lord’s doing;
It is marvelous in our eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the day which the Lord has made;
Let us rejoice and be glad in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, do save, we beseech You;
O Lord, we beseech You, do send prosperity!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord;
We have blessed you from the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is God, and He has given us light;
Bind the festival sacrifice with cords to the horns of the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are my God, and I give thanks to You;
You are my God, I extol You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good;
For His lovingkindness is everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How blessed are those whose way is blameless,
Who walk in the law of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How blessed are those who observe His testimonies,
Who seek Him with all their heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They also do no unrighteousness;
They walk in His ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have ordained Your precepts,
That we should keep them diligently.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Oh that my ways may be established
To keep Your statutes!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I shall not be ashamed
When I look upon all Your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I shall give thanks to You with uprightness of heart,
When I learn Your righteous judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I shall keep Your statutes;
Do not forsake me utterly!
speaker: Narrator

text:
How can a young man keep his way pure?
By keeping it according to Your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With all my heart I have sought You;
Do not let me wander from Your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your word I have treasured in my heart,
That I may not sin against You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed are You, O Lord;
Teach me Your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With my lips I have told of
All the ordinances of Your mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have rejoiced in the way of Your testimonies,
As much as in all riches.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will meditate on Your precepts
And regard Your ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I shall delight in Your statutes;
I shall not forget Your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deal bountifully with Your servant,
That I may live and keep Your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Open my eyes, that I may behold
Wonderful things from Your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am a stranger in the earth;
Do not hide Your commandments from me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul is crushed with longing
After Your ordinances at all times.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You rebuke the arrogant, the cursed,
Who wander from Your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Take away reproach and contempt from me,
For I observe Your testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even though princes sit and talk against me,
Your servant meditates on Your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your testimonies also are my delight;
They are my counselors.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul cleaves to the dust;
Revive me according to Your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have told of my ways, and You have answered me;
Teach me Your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make me understand the way of Your precepts,
So I will meditate on Your wonders.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul weeps because of grief;
Strengthen me according to Your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remove the false way from me,
And graciously grant me Your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have chosen the faithful way;
I have placed Your ordinances before me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I cling to Your testimonies;
O Lord, do not put me to shame!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I shall run the way of Your commandments,
For You will enlarge my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Teach me, O Lord, the way of Your statutes,
And I shall observe it to the end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give me understanding, that I may observe Your law
And keep it with all my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make me walk in the path of Your commandments,
For I delight in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Incline my heart to Your testimonies
And not to dishonest gain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn away my eyes from looking at vanity,
And revive me in Your ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Establish Your word to Your servant,
As that which produces reverence for You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn away my reproach which I dread,
For Your ordinances are good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, I long for Your precepts;
Revive me through Your righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May Your lovingkindnesses also come to me, O Lord,
Your salvation according to Your word;
speaker: Narrator

text:
So I will have an answer for him who reproaches me,
For I trust in Your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And do not take the word of truth utterly out of my mouth,
For I wait for Your ordinances.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So I will keep Your law continually,
Forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And I will walk at liberty,
For I seek Your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will also speak of Your testimonies before kings
And shall not be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I shall delight in Your commandments,
Which I love.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Remember the word to Your servant,
In which You have made me hope.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is my comfort in my affliction,
That Your word has revived me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The arrogant utterly deride me,
Yet I do not turn aside from Your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have remembered Your ordinances from of old, O Lord,
And comfort myself.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Burning indignation has seized me because of the wicked,
Who forsake Your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your statutes are my songs
In the house of my pilgrimage.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, I remember Your name in the night,
And keep Your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This has become mine,
That I observe Your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is my portion;
I have promised to keep Your words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I sought Your favor with all my heart;
Be gracious to me according to Your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I considered my ways
And turned my feet to Your testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hastened and did not delay
To keep Your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The cords of the wicked have encircled me,
But I have not forgotten Your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
At midnight I shall rise to give thanks to You
Because of Your righteous ordinances.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am a companion of all those who fear You,
And of those who keep Your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The earth is full of Your lovingkindness, O Lord;
Teach me Your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have dealt well with Your servant,
O Lord, according to Your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Teach me good discernment and knowledge,
For I believe in Your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Before I was afflicted I went astray,
But now I keep Your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are good and do good;
Teach me Your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The arrogant have forged a lie against me;
With all my heart I will observe Your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their heart is covered with fat,
But I delight in Your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is good for me that I was afflicted,
That I may learn Your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The law of Your mouth is better to me
Than thousands of gold and silver pieces.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your hands made me and fashioned me;
Give me understanding, that I may learn Your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May those who fear You see me and be glad,
Because I wait for Your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I know, O Lord, that Your judgments are righteous,
And that in faithfulness You have afflicted me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O may Your lovingkindness comfort me,
According to Your word to Your servant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May Your compassion come to me that I may live,
For Your law is my delight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the arrogant be ashamed, for they subvert me with a lie;
But I shall meditate on Your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May those who fear You turn to me,
Even those who know Your testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May my heart be blameless in Your statutes,
So that I will not be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul languishes for Your salvation;
I wait for Your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes fail with longing for Your word,
While I say, “When will You comfort me?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though I have become like a wineskin in the smoke,
I do not forget Your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How many are the days of Your servant?
When will You execute judgment on those who persecute me?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The arrogant have dug pits for me,
Men who are not in accord with Your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All Your commandments are faithful;
They have persecuted me with a lie; help me!
speaker: Narrator

text:
They almost destroyed me on earth,
But as for me, I did not forsake Your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Revive me according to Your lovingkindness,
So that I may keep the testimony of Your mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Forever, O Lord,
Your word is settled in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your faithfulness continues throughout all generations;
You established the earth, and it stands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They stand this day according to Your ordinances,
For all things are Your servants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If Your law had not been my delight,
Then I would have perished in my affliction.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will never forget Your precepts,
For by them You have revived me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am Yours, save me;
For I have sought Your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked wait for me to destroy me;
I shall diligently consider Your testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have seen a limit to all perfection;
Your commandment is exceedingly broad.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O how I love Your law!
It is my meditation all the day.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your commandments make me wiser than my enemies,
For they are ever mine.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have more insight than all my teachers,
For Your testimonies are my meditation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I understand more than the aged,
Because I have observed Your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have restrained my feet from every evil way,
That I may keep Your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have not turned aside from Your ordinances,
For You Yourself have taught me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How sweet are Your words to my taste!
Yes, sweeter than honey to my mouth!
speaker: Narrator

text:
From Your precepts I get understanding;
Therefore I hate every false way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your word is a lamp to my feet
And a light to my path.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have sworn and I will confirm it,
That I will keep Your righteous ordinances.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am exceedingly afflicted;
Revive me, O Lord, according to Your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O accept the freewill offerings of my mouth, O Lord,
And teach me Your ordinances.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My life is continually in my hand,
Yet I do not forget Your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The wicked have laid a snare for me,
Yet I have not gone astray from Your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have inherited Your testimonies forever,
For they are the joy of my heart.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have inclined my heart to perform Your statutes
Forever, even to the end.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hate those who are double-minded,
But I love Your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are my hiding place and my shield;
I wait for Your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Depart from me, evildoers,
That I may observe the commandments of my God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sustain me according to Your word, that I may live;
And do not let me be ashamed of my hope.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Uphold me that I may be safe,
That I may have regard for Your statutes continually.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have rejected all those who wander from Your statutes,
For their deceitfulness is useless.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have removed all the wicked of the earth like dross;
Therefore I love Your testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My flesh trembles for fear of You,
And I am afraid of Your judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have done justice and righteousness;
Do not leave me to my oppressors.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be surety for Your servant for good;
Do not let the arrogant oppress me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes fail with longing for Your salvation
And for Your righteous word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deal with Your servant according to Your lovingkindness
And teach me Your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am Your servant; give me understanding,
That I may know Your testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is time for the Lord to act,
For they have broken Your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore I love Your commandments
Above gold, yes, above fine gold.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore I esteem right all Your precepts concerning everything,
I hate every false way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your testimonies are wonderful;
Therefore my soul observes them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The unfolding of Your words gives light;
It gives understanding to the simple.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I opened my mouth wide and panted,
For I longed for Your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn to me and be gracious to me,
After Your manner with those who love Your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Establish my footsteps in Your word,
And do not let any iniquity have dominion over me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Redeem me from the oppression of man,
That I may keep Your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Make Your face shine upon Your servant,
And teach me Your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes shed streams of water,
Because they do not keep Your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Righteous are You, O Lord,
And upright are Your judgments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have commanded Your testimonies in righteousness
And exceeding faithfulness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My zeal has consumed me,
Because my adversaries have forgotten Your words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your word is very pure,
Therefore Your servant loves it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am small and despised,
Yet I do not forget Your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness,
And Your law is truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Trouble and anguish have come upon me,
Yet Your commandments are my delight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your testimonies are righteous forever;
Give me understanding that I may live.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I cried with all my heart; answer me, O Lord!
I will observe Your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I cried to You; save me
And I shall keep Your testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I rise before dawn and cry for help;
I wait for Your words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My eyes anticipate the night watches,
That I may meditate on Your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear my voice according to Your lovingkindness;
Revive me, O Lord, according to Your ordinances.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who follow after wickedness draw near;
They are far from Your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are near, O Lord,
And all Your commandments are truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Of old I have known from Your testimonies
That You have founded them forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look upon my affliction and rescue me,
For I do not forget Your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Plead my cause and redeem me;
Revive me according to Your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Salvation is far from the wicked,
For they do not seek Your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Great are Your mercies, O Lord;
Revive me according to Your ordinances.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Many are my persecutors and my adversaries,
Yet I do not turn aside from Your testimonies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I behold the treacherous and loathe them,
Because they do not keep Your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Consider how I love Your precepts;
Revive me, O Lord, according to Your lovingkindness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sum of Your word is truth,
And every one of Your righteous ordinances is everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Princes persecute me without cause,
But my heart stands in awe of Your words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I rejoice at Your word,
As one who finds great spoil.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hate and despise falsehood,
But I love Your law.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seven times a day I praise You,
Because of Your righteous ordinances.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who love Your law have great peace,
And nothing causes them to stumble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hope for Your salvation, O Lord,
And do Your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My soul keeps Your testimonies,
And I love them exceedingly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I keep Your precepts and Your testimonies,
For all my ways are before You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my cry come before You, O Lord;
Give me understanding according to Your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my supplication come before You;
Deliver me according to Your word.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my lips utter praise,
For You teach me Your statutes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my tongue sing of Your word,
For all Your commandments are righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let Your hand be ready to help me,
For I have chosen Your precepts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I long for Your salvation, O Lord,
And Your law is my delight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let my soul live that it may praise You,
And let Your ordinances help me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek Your servant,
For I do not forget Your commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In my trouble I cried to the Lord,
And He answered me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Deliver my soul, O Lord, from lying lips,
From a deceitful tongue.
speaker: Narrator

text:
What shall be given to you, and what more shall be done to you,
You deceitful tongue?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sharp arrows of the warrior,
With the burning coals of the broom tree.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Woe is me, for I sojourn in Meshech,
For I dwell among the tents of Kedar!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Too long has my soul had its dwelling
With those who hate peace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am for peace, but when I speak,
They are for war.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will lift up my eyes to the mountains;
From where shall my help come?
speaker: Narrator

text:
My help comes from the Lord,
Who made heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will not allow your foot to slip;
He who keeps you will not slumber.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, He who keeps Israel
Will neither slumber nor sleep.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is your keeper;
The Lord is your shade on your right hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sun will not smite you by day,
Nor the moon by night.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will protect you from all evil;
He will keep your soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will guard your going out and your coming in
From this time forth and forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was glad when they said to me,
“Let us go to the house of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our feet are standing
Within your gates, O Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jerusalem, that is built
As a city that is compact together;
speaker: Narrator

text:
To which the tribes go up, even the tribes of the Lord—
An ordinance for Israel—
To give thanks to the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For there thrones were set for judgment,
The thrones of the house of David.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pray for the peace of Jerusalem:
“May they prosper who love you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“May peace be within your walls,
And prosperity within your palaces.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the sake of my brothers and my friends,
I will now say, “May peace be within you.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the sake of the house of the Lord our God,
I will seek your good.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To You I lift up my eyes,
O You who are enthroned in the heavens!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, as the eyes of servants look to the hand of their master,
As the eyes of a maid to the hand of her mistress,
So our eyes look to the Lord our God,
Until He is gracious to us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be gracious to us, O Lord, be gracious to us,
For we are greatly filled with contempt.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our soul is greatly filled
With the scoffing of those who are at ease,
And with the contempt of the proud.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Had it not been the Lord who was on our side,”
Let Israel now say,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Had it not been the Lord who was on our side
When men rose up against us,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they would have swallowed us alive,
When their anger was kindled against us;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the waters would have engulfed us,
The stream would have swept over our soul;
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the raging waters would have swept over our soul.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be the Lord,
Who has not given us to be torn by their teeth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our soul has escaped as a bird out of the snare of the trapper;
The snare is broken and we have escaped.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Our help is in the name of the Lord,
Who made heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who trust in the Lord
Are as Mount Zion, which cannot be moved but abides forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As the mountains surround Jerusalem,
So the Lord surrounds His people
From this time forth and forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the scepter of wickedness shall not rest upon the land of the righteous,
So that the righteous will not put forth their hands to do wrong.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do good, O Lord, to those who are good
And to those who are upright in their hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But as for those who turn aside to their crooked ways,
The Lord will lead them away with the doers of iniquity.
Peace be upon Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When the Lord brought back the captive ones of Zion,
We were like those who dream.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then our mouth was filled with laughter
And our tongue with joyful shouting;
Then they said among the nations,
“The Lord has done great things for them.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has done great things for us;
We are glad.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Restore our captivity, O Lord,
As the streams in the South.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who sow in tears shall reap with joyful shouting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who goes to and fro weeping, carrying his bag of seed,
Shall indeed come again with a shout of joy, bringing his sheaves with him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Unless the Lord builds the house,
They labor in vain who build it;
Unless the Lord guards the city,
The watchman keeps awake in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is vain for you to rise up early,
To retire late,
To eat the bread of painful labors;
For He gives to His beloved even in his sleep.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, children are a gift of the Lord,
The fruit of the womb is a reward.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like arrows in the hand of a warrior,
So are the children of one’s youth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
How blessed is everyone who fears the Lord,
Who walks in His ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When you shall eat of the fruit of your hands,
You will be happy and it will be well with you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your wife shall be like a fruitful vine
Within your house,
Your children like olive plants
Around your table.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, for thus shall the man be blessed
Who fears the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord bless you from Zion,
And may you see the prosperity of Jerusalem all the days of your life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, may you see your children’s children.
Peace be upon Israel!
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Many times they have persecuted me from my youth up,”
Let Israel now say,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Many times they have persecuted me from my youth up;
Yet they have not prevailed against me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“The plowers plowed upon my back;
They lengthened their furrows.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is righteous;
He has cut in two the cords of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May all who hate Zion
Be put to shame and turned backward;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them be like grass upon the housetops,
Which withers before it grows up;
speaker: Narrator

text:
With which the reaper does not fill his hand,
Or the binder of sheaves his bosom;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: Out of the depths I have cried to You, O Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lord, hear my voice!
Let Your ears be attentive
To the voice of my supplications.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If You, Lord, should mark iniquities,
O Lord, who could stand?
speaker: Narrator

text:
But there is forgiveness with You,
That You may be feared.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I wait for the Lord, my soul does wait,
And in His word do I hope.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
And He will redeem Israel
From all his iniquities.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
O Israel, hope in the Lord
From this time forth and forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember, O Lord, on David’s behalf,
All his affliction;
speaker: Narrator

text:
How he swore to the Lord
And vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Surely I will not enter my house,
Nor lie on my bed;
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will not give sleep to my eyes
Or slumber to my eyelids,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Until I find a place for the Lord,
A dwelling place for the Mighty One of Jacob.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, we heard of it in Ephrathah,
We found it in the field of Jaar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let us go into His dwelling place;
Let us worship at His footstool.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Arise, O Lord, to Your resting place,
You and the ark of Your strength.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let Your priests be clothed with righteousness,
And let Your godly ones sing for joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the sake of David Your servant,
Do not turn away the face of Your anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has sworn to David
A truth from which He will not turn back:
“Of the fruit of your body I will set upon your throne.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“If your sons will keep My covenant
And My testimony which I will teach them,
Their sons also shall sit upon your throne forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord has chosen Zion;
He has desired it for His habitation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“This is My resting place forever;
Here I will dwell, for I have desired it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I will abundantly bless her provision;
I will satisfy her needy with bread.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Her priests also I will clothe with salvation,
And her godly ones will sing aloud for joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“There I will cause the horn of David to spring forth;
I have prepared a lamp for Mine anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“His enemies I will clothe with shame,
But upon himself his crown shall shine.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, how good and how pleasant it is
For brothers to dwell together in unity!
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is like the precious oil upon the head,
Coming down upon the beard,
Even Aaron’s beard,
Coming down upon the edge of his robes.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Behold, bless the Lord, all servants of the Lord,
Who serve by night in the house of the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Lift up your hands to the sanctuary
And bless the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May the Lord bless you from Zion,
He who made heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
You who stand in the house of the Lord,
In the courts of the house of our God!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, for the Lord is good;
Sing praises to His name, for it is lovely.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord has chosen Jacob for Himself,
Israel for His own possession.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I know that the Lord is great
And that our Lord is above all gods.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whatever the Lord pleases, He does,
In heaven and in earth, in the seas and in all deeps.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
He smote the firstborn of Egypt,
Both of man and beast.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sent signs and wonders into your midst, O Egypt,
Upon Pharaoh and all his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He smote many nations
And slew mighty kings,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
And He gave their land as a heritage,
A heritage to Israel His people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your name, O Lord, is everlasting,
Your remembrance, O Lord, throughout all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord will judge His people
And will have compassion on His servants.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The idols of the nations are but silver and gold,
The work of man’s hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have mouths, but they do not speak;
They have eyes, but they do not see;
speaker: Narrator

text:
They have ears, but they do not hear,
Nor is there any breath at all in their mouths.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who make them will be like them,
Yes, everyone who trusts in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O house of Israel, bless the Lord;
O house of Aaron, bless the Lord;
speaker: Narrator

text:
O house of Levi, bless the Lord;
You who revere the Lord, bless the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed be the Lord from Zion,
Who dwells in Jerusalem.
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the God of gods,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the Lord of lords,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To Him who alone does great wonders,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting;
speaker: Narrator

text:
To Him who made the heavens with skill,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting;
speaker: Narrator

text:
To Him who spread out the earth above the waters,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting;
speaker: Narrator

text:
To Him who made the great lights,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting:
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sun to rule by day,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting,
speaker: Narrator

text:
The moon and stars to rule by night,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To Him who smote the Egyptians in their firstborn,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And brought Israel out from their midst,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting,
speaker: Narrator

text:
With a strong hand and an outstretched arm,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To Him who divided the Red Sea asunder,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And made Israel pass through the midst of it,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting;
speaker: Narrator

text:
But He overthrew Pharaoh and his army in the Red Sea,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To Him who led His people through the wilderness,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting;
speaker: Narrator

text:
To Him who smote great kings,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And slew mighty kings,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting:
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sihon, king of the Amorites,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And Og, king of Bashan,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And gave their land as a heritage,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even a heritage to Israel His servant,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who remembered us in our low estate,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And has rescued us from our adversaries,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who gives food to all flesh,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Give thanks to the God of heaven,
For His lovingkindness is everlasting.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By the rivers of Babylon,
There we sat down and wept,
When we remembered Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Upon the willows in the midst of it
We hung our harps.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For there our captors demanded of us songs,
And our tormentors mirth, saying,
“Sing us one of the songs of Zion.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
How can we sing the Lord’s song
In a foreign land?
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I forget you, O Jerusalem,
May my right hand forget her skill.
speaker: Narrator

text:
May my tongue cling to the roof of my mouth
If I do not remember you,
If I do not exalt Jerusalem
Above my chief joy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Remember, O Lord, against the sons of Edom
The day of Jerusalem,
Who said, “Raze it, raze it
To its very foundation.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
O daughter of Babylon, you devastated one,
How blessed will be the one who repays you
With the recompense with which you have repaid us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How blessed will be the one who seizes and dashes your little ones
Against the rock.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give You thanks with all my heart;
I will sing praises to You before the gods.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
On the day I called, You answered me;
You made me bold with strength in my soul.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the kings of the earth will give thanks to You, O Lord,
When they have heard the words of Your mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And they will sing of the ways of the Lord,
For great is the glory of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For though the Lord is exalted,
Yet He regards the lowly,
But the haughty He knows from afar.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text: O Lord, You have searched me and known me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You know when I sit down and when I rise up;
You understand my thought from afar.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You scrutinize my path and my lying down,
And are intimately acquainted with all my ways.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even before there is a word on my tongue,
Behold, O Lord, You know it all.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have enclosed me behind and before,
And laid Your hand upon me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Such knowledge is too wonderful for me;
It is too high, I cannot attain to it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Where can I go from Your Spirit?
Or where can I flee from Your presence?
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I ascend to heaven, You are there;
If I make my bed in Sheol, behold, You are there.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I take the wings of the dawn,
If I dwell in the remotest part of the sea,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even there Your hand will lead me,
And Your right hand will lay hold of me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I say, “Surely the darkness will overwhelm me,
And the light around me will be night,”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even the darkness is not dark to You,
And the night is as bright as the day.
Darkness and light are alike to You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For You formed my inward parts;
You wove me in my mother’s womb.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Your eyes have seen my unformed substance;
And in Your book were all written
The days that were ordained for me,
When as yet there was not one of them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How precious also are Your thoughts to me, O God!
How vast is the sum of them!
speaker: Narrator

text:
If I should count them, they would outnumber the sand.
When I awake, I am still with You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O that You would slay the wicked, O God;
Depart from me, therefore, men of bloodshed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they speak against You wickedly,
And Your enemies take Your name in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do I not hate those who hate You, O Lord?
And do I not loathe those who rise up against You?
speaker: Narrator

text:
I hate them with the utmost hatred;
They have become my enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Search me, O God, and know my heart;
Try me and know my anxious thoughts;
speaker: Narrator

text:
And see if there be any hurtful way in me,
And lead me in the everlasting way.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rescue me, O Lord, from evil men;
Preserve me from violent men
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who devise evil things in their hearts;
They continually stir up wars.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They sharpen their tongues as a serpent;
Poison of a viper is under their lips. Selah.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
I said to the Lord, “You are my God;
Give ear, O Lord, to the voice of my supplications.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“O God the Lord, the strength of my salvation,
You have covered my head in the day of battle.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Do not grant, O Lord, the desires of the wicked;
Do not promote his evil device, that they not be exalted. Selah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“As for the head of those who surround me,
May the mischief of their lips cover them.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“May a slanderer not be established in the earth;
May evil hunt the violent man speedily.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I know that the Lord will maintain the cause of the afflicted
And justice for the poor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Surely the righteous will give thanks to Your name;
The upright will dwell in Your presence.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, I call upon You; hasten to me!
Give ear to my voice when I call to You!
speaker: Narrator

text:
May my prayer be counted as incense before You;
The lifting up of my hands as the evening offering.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Set a guard, O Lord, over my mouth;
Keep watch over the door of my lips.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not incline my heart to any evil thing,
To practice deeds of wickedness
With men who do iniquity;
And do not let me eat of their delicacies.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Their judges are thrown down by the sides of the rock,
And they hear my words, for they are pleasant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As when one plows and breaks open the earth,
Our bones have been scattered at the mouth of Sheol.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For my eyes are toward You, O God, the Lord;
In You I take refuge; do not leave me defenseless.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Keep me from the jaws of the trap which they have set for me,
And from the snares of those who do iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the wicked fall into their own nets,
While I pass by safely.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I cry aloud with my voice to the Lord;
I make supplication with my voice to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I pour out my complaint before Him;
I declare my trouble before Him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
When my spirit was overwhelmed within me,
You knew my path.
In the way where I walk
They have hidden a trap for me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
“Give heed to my cry,
For I am brought very low;
Deliver me from my persecutors,
For they are too strong for me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Bring my soul out of prison,
So that I may give thanks to Your name;
The righteous will surround me,
For You will deal bountifully with me.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear my prayer, O Lord,
Give ear to my supplications!
Answer me in Your faithfulness, in Your righteousness!
speaker: Narrator

text:
And do not enter into judgment with Your servant,
For in Your sight no man living is righteous.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Therefore my spirit is overwhelmed within me;
My heart is appalled within me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I stretch out my hands to You;
My soul longs for You, as a parched land. Selah.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Deliver me, O Lord, from my enemies;
I take refuge in You.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For the sake of Your name, O Lord, revive me.
In Your righteousness bring my soul out of trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And in Your lovingkindness, cut off my enemies
And destroy all those who afflict my soul,
For I am Your servant.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
My lovingkindness and my fortress,
My stronghold and my deliverer,
My shield and He in whom I take refuge,
Who subdues my people under me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, what is man, that You take knowledge of him?
Or the son of man, that You think of him?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Man is like a mere breath;
His days are like a passing shadow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bow Your heavens, O Lord, and come down;
Touch the mountains, that they may smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Flash forth lightning and scatter them;
Send out Your arrows and confuse them.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Whose mouths speak deceit,
And whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will sing a new song to You, O God;
Upon a harp of ten strings I will sing praises to You,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who gives salvation to kings,
Who rescues David His servant from the evil sword.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rescue me and deliver me out of the hand of aliens,
Whose mouth speaks deceit
And whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let our sons in their youth be as grown-up plants,
And our daughters as corner pillars fashioned as for a palace;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let our garners be full, furnishing every kind of produce,
And our flocks bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our fields;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let our cattle bear
Without mishap and without loss,
Let there be no outcry in our streets!
speaker: Narrator

text:
How blessed are the people who are so situated;
How blessed are the people whose God is the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will extol You, my God, O King,
And I will bless Your name forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Every day I will bless You,
And I will praise Your name forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Great is the Lord, and highly to be praised,
And His greatness is unsearchable.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One generation shall praise Your works to another,
And shall declare Your mighty acts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
On the glorious splendor of Your majesty
And on Your wonderful works, I will meditate.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Men shall speak of the power of Your awesome acts,
And I will tell of Your greatness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shall eagerly utter the memory of Your abundant goodness
And will shout joyfully of Your righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is gracious and merciful;
Slow to anger and great in lovingkindness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is good to all,
And His mercies are over all His works.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All Your works shall give thanks to You, O Lord,
And Your godly ones shall bless You.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shall speak of the glory of Your kingdom
And talk of Your power;
speaker: Narrator

text:
To make known to the sons of men Your mighty acts
And the glory of the majesty of Your kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom,
And Your dominion endures throughout all generations.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord sustains all who fall
And raises up all who are bowed down.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The eyes of all look to You,
And You give them their food in due time.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You open Your hand
And satisfy the desire of every living thing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is righteous in all His ways
And kind in all His deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is near to all who call upon Him,
To all who call upon Him in truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He will fulfill the desire of those who fear Him;
He will also hear their cry and will save them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord keeps all who love Him,
But all the wicked He will destroy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My mouth will speak the praise of the Lord,
And all flesh will bless His holy name forever and ever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord!
Praise the Lord, O my soul!
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will praise the Lord while I live;
I will sing praises to my God while I have my being.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not trust in princes,
In mortal man, in whom there is no salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
His spirit departs, he returns to the earth;
In that very day his thoughts perish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How blessed is he whose help is the God of Jacob,
Whose hope is in the Lord his God,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
The Lord will reign forever,
Your God, O Zion, to all generations.
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The Lord builds up Jerusalem;
He gathers the outcasts of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He heals the brokenhearted
And binds up their wounds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He counts the number of the stars;
He gives names to all of them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Great is our Lord and abundant in strength;
His understanding is infinite.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord supports the afflicted;
He brings down the wicked to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sing to the Lord with thanksgiving;
Sing praises to our God on the lyre,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who covers the heavens with clouds,
Who provides rain for the earth,
Who makes grass to grow on the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gives to the beast its food,
And to the young ravens which cry.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He does not delight in the strength of the horse;
He does not take pleasure in the legs of a man.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord favors those who fear Him,
Those who wait for His lovingkindness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord, O Jerusalem!
Praise your God, O Zion!
speaker: Narrator

text:
For He has strengthened the bars of your gates;
He has blessed your sons within you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He makes peace in your borders;
He satisfies you with the finest of the wheat.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sends forth His command to the earth;
His word runs very swiftly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gives snow like wool;
He scatters the frost like ashes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He casts forth His ice as fragments;
Who can stand before His cold?
speaker: Narrator

text:
He sends forth His word and melts them;
He causes His wind to blow and the waters to flow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He declares His words to Jacob,
His statutes and His ordinances to Israel.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Praise Him, all His angels;
Praise Him, all His hosts!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise Him, sun and moon;
Praise Him, all stars of light!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise Him, highest heavens,
And the waters that are above the heavens!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them praise the name of the Lord,
For He commanded and they were created.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has also established them forever and ever;
He has made a decree which will not pass away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord from the earth,
Sea monsters and all deeps;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fire and hail, snow and clouds;
Stormy wind, fulfilling His word;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Mountains and all hills;
Fruit trees and all cedars;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Beasts and all cattle;
Creeping things and winged fowl;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Kings of the earth and all peoples;
Princes and all judges of the earth;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Both young men and virgins;
Old men and children.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
And He has lifted up a horn for His people,
Praise for all His godly ones;
Even for the sons of Israel, a people near to Him.
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise the Lord!
Sing to the Lord a new song,
And His praise in the congregation of the godly ones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let Israel be glad in his Maker;
Let the sons of Zion rejoice in their King.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them praise His name with dancing;
Let them sing praises to Him with timbrel and lyre.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord takes pleasure in His people;
He will beautify the afflicted ones with salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the godly ones exult in glory;
Let them sing for joy on their beds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the high praises of God be in their mouth,
And a two-edged sword in their hand,
speaker: Narrator

text:
To execute vengeance on the nations
And punishment on the peoples,
speaker: Narrator

text:
To bind their kings with chains
And their nobles with fetters of iron,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Praise Him for His mighty deeds;
Praise Him according to His excellent greatness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise Him with trumpet sound;
Praise Him with harp and lyre.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise Him with timbrel and dancing;
Praise Him with stringed instruments and pipe.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Praise Him with loud cymbals;
Praise Him with resounding cymbals.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let everything that has breath praise the Lord.
Praise the Lord!
speaker: Narrator
